Homecourse 








 








 


Curriculum 

		
                            DURATION:                4 Years




ENROLL NOW                


Infrastructure
Events/Activities





 







Categories
UG Programs 




Vision
To be a leader in imparting knowledge of creating efficient and effective systems for manufacturing and service organizations.
Mission
Foster innovative Industrial Engineering learning environment for productivity improvement through quality standards, research, and reapplication to similar situations.
Features of Department

The only department accredited for a period for 6 years in the institute
Industry Internships and live projects with leading industries like Mahindra & Mahindra, MSRTC, TCS etc.
Training at MOIL, Hindalco & Ordnance Factories
SAE-supra, BAJA activities
Multiple Industrial Visits throughout the semester
IES, Vibrant student body
Regular Motivation and coaching for GATE, ILTES, TOEFL in the Department
Well equipped laboratories
Most sought after branch in the college
Department accredited with Indian Institution of Industrial Engineering(IIIE) Nagpur Student Chapter

Program Objectives

IE students prepared for work, higher studies, or entrepreneurship
Expertise in creating Man-Machine Material systems for productivity
Understanding of Information & Technology, Mechanical & Production Engineering
Management courses for professionalism
Involvement in student bodies for communication, team spirit & social awareness
Desire for lifelong learning and adapting to technological changes.

Program Outcomes

Utilize mathematics, science, engineering fundamentals, and specialized knowledge to solve complex engineering problems.
Identify and analyze complex engineering problems, using research-based knowledge and first principles.
Design solutions and components that meet public health, safety, and environmental considerations.
Conduct investigations and synthesize information to provide valid conclusions.
Use appropriate modern engineering and IT tools and techniques with an understanding of their limitations.
Assess societal and ethical implications of engineering solutions and practice responsibility.
Understand the need for sustainable development in engineering practice.
Adhere to ethical principles and professional responsibilities.
Work effectively in diverse teams and settings.
Communicate complex engineering information effectively to peers and society.
Apply engineering and management principles to manage projects and work in multidisciplinary environments

Career Prospects
Graduates can work as manufacturing technician, quality assurance inspector, industrial mechanic, industrial electrician, industrial designer, manufacturing production supervisor, supply chain analyst, etc. 
Placement
According to the latest data based on the year 2021-22, 45 students got placed, 2 opted for entrepreneurship and 4 went for higher studies.

Information Technology


Homecourse 








 








 


Curriculum 

		
                            DURATION:                4 Years




ENROLL NOW                


Infrastructure
Events And Activities




 







Categories
UG Programs 




Vision
To establish the department as a major source of manpower for the IT sector.
Mission
Cultivate engineering graduates in IT with solid technical proficiency, effective communication abilities, and the capacity to excel in their professional endeavors. 
Features of Department

Accredited twice by National board of Accreditation, AICTE.
Excellent infrastructure; all laboratories are well equipped and classrooms are ICT enabled.
Well qualified faculty with average teaching experience of 17 years
A strong alumni network; conducts its own annual alumni meet.
Active participation of industry experts in curriculum conduction.
Excellent placement record.

Programme Objectives

Goal: Produce skilled IT professionals with a strong foundation in engineering and exposure to new technologies.
Objectives: Develop graduates with problem-solving skills, teamwork abilities, adaptability, and a commitment to lifelong learning.
Values: Instill in graduates an appreciation for the environment, society, ethics, and effective communication.

Program Outcomes

Engineering competency: Apply mathematical, scientific, and engineering knowledge to solve complex engineering problems, while also considering societal and environmental impacts.
Problem-solving skills: Analyze research literature and apply first principles to identify and formulate solutions to complex engineering problems.
Design and development skills: Design and develop system components or processes that meet specific needs while also considering public health, safety, cultural, societal, and environmental factors.
Research skills: Use research-based knowledge and methods, including data analysis and synthesis, to investigate complex problems and provide valid conclusions.
Modern tool usage: Apply appropriate techniques, resources, and engineering and IT tools, including modeling and prediction, with an understanding of their limitations.
Social responsibility: Assess societal, legal, health, safety, and cultural issues relevant to professional engineering practice and take responsibility for their impact.
Sustainability: Understand the impact of engineering solutions on society and the environment, and demonstrate knowledge of sustainable development.
Ethics: Apply ethical principles and norms in engineering practice.
Teamwork and communication: Work effectively as an individual or in diverse teams, and communicate complex engineering activities to the engineering community and society at large.
Project management and finance: Demonstrate knowledge of engineering and management principles to manage projects in multidisciplinary environments.
Life-long learning: Recognize the need for independent and life-long learning in the context of technological chang

Program Specific Outcomes

Demonstrating logic development skills and mathematical concepts to solve real-world problems.
Understanding computer systems principles, software engineering principles, and proficiency in various programming languages and open-source platforms. 
Applying computing knowledge to solve real-world problems, conducting research, preparing for higher studies, and using cutting-edge technologies to develop IT systems. 

Career Prospects
IT Graduates can expect professional career opportunities in IT areas such as system analysis, design, development, support,mobile and distributed application development, web/ecommerce development, database administration, computer hardware, networking. 
Placement
According to the latest data based on the year 2021, 97.18% students got placed out of which 74.64% got industry internship. The highest package was 16 lakhs and the average package was 7.11 lakhs.

Amazon
Barclays

Wipro

Mechanical Engineering


Homecourse 








 








 


Curriculum 

		
                            DURATION:                4 Years




ENROLL NOW                


Infrastructure
Events/Activities





 







Categories
UG Programs 




Vision
We aim to inculcate in students flair for excellence to become technological leader in industry and society.
Mission
Create a stimulating learning environment for students and prepare them for industry and society-focused research.
Features of Department

Well qualified and dynamic teaching faculty with 11 PhD’s having average teaching experience of more than 18 years.
More than 100 Research Publications in National, International Journals and Conferences.
Active Student Body
SAE INDIA Collegiate Clubs

ISHRAE Student Chapter
Robotics Club
Mechasso



Program Objectives

The graduates shall be capable to accept challenges in Engineering industries.
They shall demonstrate core competency to design, analyze and evaluate various engineering systems.
They shall be able to apply computational and professional skills in corporate world.
The program shall prepare the graduates for higher studies, entrepreneurship and create awareness about lifelong learning.

Program Outcomes

Apply math, science, engineering fundamentals, and specialization to complex engineering problems.
Identify, formulate, and analyze complex engineering problems using research-based knowledge.
Design solutions and system components/processes for complex engineering problems with consideration for safety, societal and environmental impacts.
Investigate complex problems using research-based knowledge and methods, including data analysis and synthesis.
Select and apply appropriate modern engineering and IT tools and techniques to complex engineering activities.
Consider societal, health, safety, legal, and cultural issues in engineering practice and responsibilities.
Understand and demonstrate the importance of sustainable development in engineering solutions.
Apply ethical principles and norms to engineering practice.
Work effectively in individual and team settings, including multidisciplinary environments.
Communicate effectively on complex engineering activities with the engineering community and society at large.
Demonstrate knowledge of engineering and management principles to manage projects and work effectively in multidisciplinary environments.
Recognize and engage in lifelong learning to adapt to technological changes. 

Program Specific Outcomes

The graduates shall be capable for design, production and operations in core mechanical domain and management of interdisciplinary applications.
They shall be capable of carrying out the analysis of mechanical and allied systems and provide numerical and computer based solution.

Career Prospects
Mechanical Engineers are required in the core and software industries alike. They have a wide work in thermal power industry, gas turbines industry, air conditioning and refrigeration industry, oil and gas exploration and refining industries, agricultural sector, educational sector, aviation companies, shipping industries, aerospace industry, armed forces, pharmaceutical, automobile industry and many others. 
Placements
According to the latest data based on the year 2021, out of 79 students, 60 students got placed on campus, 4 opted for higher studies and 1 opted for entrepreneurship.

Infrastructure

Categories
UG Programs 




Vision
To establish the department as a major source of manpower.
Mission
Cultivate engineering graduates with solid technical proficiency, effective communication abilities, and the capacity to excel in their professional endeavors. 
Features of Department

Program goes beyond subject barriers to teach engineering and science aspects of biomedical engineering.
Blended and experiential learning modes are used.
Engineering Honors/Minor Programme with extra certification is offered.

Programme Objectives 

Develop graduates with expertise in mathematics, science, and engineering fundamentals to solve biomedical engineering problems and create innovative solutions for human health improvement.
Equip graduates with knowledge at the interface of engineering and life sciences.
Encourage graduates to apply engineering skills to develop enabling technologies for health care.
Foster communication and ethical behavior among students across professional and disciplinary boundaries.
Instill in graduates an attitude for lifelong learning to excel in their careers and higher studies.

Career Prospects
Medical technology encompasses various career paths such as Design and Manufacturing for medical instruments, Software for medical instruments, Quality Control of medical instruments, Researcher, and Hospital Administration.These career paths offer individuals the chance to make significant contributions to the healthcare industry.

Home 






















 At RCOEM, we prepare students for the challenges of the industry and to help them build successful careers.  We have a dedicated team of experienced faculty members who provide quality education to students and help them develop their technical and managerial skills. The postgraduate programs at RCOEM are the perfect choice for students looking to pursue a career in the fields of engineering, management, and computer applications. 



Programs 



 



 
M.Tech in Structural Engineering





 
M.Tech in Geotechnical Engineering





 
M.Tech in Power Electronics & Power System





 
M.Tech VLSI Design





 
Masters in Industrial Engineering





 
M.tech in Robotics And Automation





 
M.Tech in Computer Science





 
Management Technology Department







Eligibility:  
An undergraduate degree in Science and technology with 50 - 60% marks from a recognized board.  



Why RCOEM is the best college in Nagpur? 



RCOEM has a strong legacy of providing quality education and is consistently ranked among the top colleges in India. We have experienced faculty, state-of-the-art infrastructure, and strong industry partnerships, providing students with ample opportunities to interact with industry professionals and gain practical training experience. We offer a range of Master of Engineering (M.E.) and Master of Business Administration (MBA) programs designed to provide students with advanced knowledge and skills in their respective fields.

Master of Computer Application (MCA)


Homecourse 








 








 


Curriculum 

		
                            DURATION:                2 Years




ENROLL NOW                


Infrastructure
Events/ Activities




 







Categories
PG Programs 




Vision
To pursue excellence in quality education, research and innovation through teamwork with a focus on computer applications for the benefit of the industry, students and society.
Mission
The Department of Computer Application is working to impart quality education with a dedicated and highly motivated faculty. We also strive to foster mutually beneficial relationships with industry and academia.
Program Outcomes

An ability to apply knowledge of computing fundamentals and mathematics across disciplines.
An ability to identify, formulate and implement complex computing solutions using principles of mathematics, computing and relevant domain knowledge.
An ability to design, analyze and evaluate solutions for complex computing problems taking into account cultural, societal and environmental aspects.
An ability to design and conduct experiments, analyze and interpret data to provide valid conclusions.
An ability to apply current techniques, skills and appropriate tools in various domains in the field of IT.
An ability to understand professional ethics, legal and social issues along with cyber regulations.
An ability to engage in life-long learning and continuing professional development.
Apply the understanding of management principles with computing knowledge to manage projects in multidisciplinary environments.
To inculcate an ability to communicate effectively in written and verbal form to a variety of audiences about complex computing activities.
An ability to understand the impact of local and global computing on individuals, organizations and society.
An ability to apply the principles of teamwork, leadership and collaboration to function productively and professionally.
An ability to develop as an entrepreneur in the software domain through innovative approaches and benefit society at large.

Program Specific Outcomes

Understand, analyze and develop computer programs related to algorithms, system software, multimedia, web design and networking for the efficient design of computer-based systems of varying complexity.
Apply standard engineering practices using an open-source programming environment to deliver a quality product for business success.
Be acquainted with contemporary issues and the latest trends in technological development and thereby innovate new ideas and solutions to existing problems.

Features of the Department

Two shifts with a total intake of 120 students (60 in each shift).
Offers a 2-year full-time course with each year divided into two semesters.
Equipped with modern infrastructure and state-of-art laboratories.
Phenomenal placements and institute-backed internship efforts.
Most preferred destination in central India for students opting for the MCA course.
Focus on student-centric teaching/ learning through the introduction of CBCS (Choice Based Credit System).
The syllabus was designed to align with the current requirement of the IT Industry.
Creating quality professionals for the IT and ITES sector.
Enabling personality development of students by conducting annual workshops on aptitude development (WAD).
The signing of MOU with the companies in the region for knowledge upgradation and training of students and staff of the department.
Setting up labs in association with the industry as part of industry interaction.
High conversion rate of six-month internships into placements.

Career Prospects

The MCA course offers a variety of course specializations due to which a multitude of job profiles are created.
The course has a wide acceptance and offers excellent career opportunities in various industries including software development companies in the areas of System analysis/design/developments/supports, mobile application programming, game programming, web and e-commerce development, database administration, software testing, education and training etc.
Multinational corporations and many software companies in India hire candidates with MCA degrees.
MCA graduates can also avail the prospect of going abroad for off-shore development in the top IT companies across the world. Many government organizations also hire them.
The employability and career growth prospects for an MCA graduate are extremely high.

 M.Tech in Power Electronics & Power System

We focus on research and innovation to create a culture of consistent learning.

Management Technology Department


Homecourse 








 








 


Curriculum 

		
                            DURATION:                2 Years (Full Time)




ENROLL NOW                


Infrastructure
Events And Activities





 







Categories
PG Programs 




Vision 
We aim to provide top-quality management education to fulfill the societal demands and become a distinguished center of learning. 
Mission
Create a dynamic learning and research environment in management, fostering competent and ethical leaders for organizations. 
About Department
The Department of Management Technology offers a full-time course for quality management education and research in the country. The program includes outdoor activities, such as sports competitions and cultural events, to provide holistic education and develop future leaders. The two-year course consists of four semesters and requires a degree in graduation with over 60% marks and completion of an MBA entrance exam
Program Objectives

Our program aims to equip management graduates with leadership and managerial skills to effectively manage change and achieve organizational objectives.
We aim to develop functional management proficiency, diagnostic and problem-solving competency in management graduates to foster creativity, innovation, and entrepreneurship.
We aim to cultivate values, professional ethics, and social responsibility in management graduates, enabling them to become committed and ethical professionals.

Outcomes

Our graduates shall have necessary domain knowledge in the functional areas of business to achieve organizational objectives.
Necessary Managerial skills and abilities.
Required ability to work and lead effectively in the team based environment.
Analytical and critical thinking abilities for data based decision making and problem solving.
Understand ethical issues and will be able to demonstrate professionalism and ethical behavior.
An ability to understand the business environment and will be able to demonstrate entrepreneurial abilities in new or existing enterprise

Master of Business Administration (MBA)
This is a full-time course offered by the Department of Management Technology with a vision of offering quality management education and research in the country.
To make sure a holistic management education is assured and to assist the graduates develop into modern leaders of the future, we provide possibilities outside the lecture rooms as well, be it commercial interactions, sports activities competitions, or cultural or entrepreneurial pursuits. The quality of instruction, meticulous curriculum and exposure that the scholars get at the department coupled with a Summer Internship helps them get organized and withstand the demanding corporate world.
It is a two-year course divided into four semesters. To seek admission in this course a candidate need to have a Degree with more than 60% marks and should have appeared for the MBA State level (CET) or any National Level (CAT, MAT, XATetc) Entrance examination.
Program Objectives

PEO1: Our management graduates will progress in their careers and shall have the leadership and managerial skills needed for achieving their organizational objectives.
PEO2: Our management graduates shall have functional management proficiency, diagnostic and problem-solving competency enabling them to act with creativity, innovativeness and entrepreneurial spirit.
PEO3: Our management graduates will demonstrate values and professional ethics as well as become socially responsible and committed professionals.

Program Outcomes

MBA graduates will have the necessary domain knowledge in the functional areas of business to achieve organizational objectives.
MBA Graduates will have the necessary managerial skills and abilities.
MBA graduates will have the necessary ability to work and lead effectively in a team-based environment.
MBA graduates will have analytical and critical thinking abilities for data-based decision-making and problem-solving.
MBA graduates will understand ethical issues and will be able to demonstrate professionalism and ethical behaviour.
MBA graduates will have the ability to understand the business environment and will be able to demonstrate entrepreneurial abilities in new or existing enterprises.

MBA Integrated
About MBA Integrated 
The Masters of Business Administration (Integrated) is a unique 5 year course approved by AICTE. HSSC (XII class) passed students in any stream i.e. Science, Arts or Commerce. The course aims to create management professionals of high expertise through a learning environment that promotes innovation and creativity. Additionally, our Industry allied curriculum enables the student to learn and adapt to the regional and global business environment thereby creating business leaders and enterpreneurs.
Program Objectives

 Leadership and problem-solving skills to achieve organizational objectives with ingenuity and entrepreneurial spirit. 
Embody high standards of values and ethics, becoming socially responsible professionals.

Program Outcomes

The graduates shall have the latest disciplinary and interdisciplinary business and management knowledge and apply the appropriate skills to use modern technology to improve business performance. 
Implement skill sets to communicate effectively, work collaboratively, and lead in diverse environments.
Develop an innovative and entrepreneurial approach to analyze problems, and exhibit entrepreneurial abilities in new or existing enterprise.
Have knowledge of ethics and ethical standards and an ability to apply these while making decisions for creating sustainable workplaces and community.
An ability to think critically, analyze data, make decisions and solve complex problems of the business world.
Understand the global business scenario and possess the required skills to solve problems in the respective local, regional and global environments.

Career Prospects
A Masters of Business Administration opens doors for students to work in various industries, banks and those organizations where management of material and operations, manpower, marketing of products and services, and financial aspects have to be managed. 
Placements 
According to the data based on the year 2020-21, students received a total number of 172 offers, out of which 125 were single offers. The highest salary offered that year was INR 7.8 LPA and the average was 5.59 LPA. 
List of some of the leading companies participating in the placement drive

Amazon
HCL
Byjus
OPPO
Vivo
Just Dial
ITC
Mahindra
ICICI

M.Tech in Structural Engineering


Homecourse 








 








 


Curriculum 

		
                            DURATION:                2 Years




ENROLL NOW                







 







Categories
PG Programs 




The Civil Engineering Department offers a two-year full-time M. Tech. (Structural Engineering) program. The course covers topics such as structural analysis, earthquake engineering, and design of high rise structures. The program includes exposure to analysis and design softwares like STAAD.pro and offers industry internships to improve employability. In addition to this, Industry experts contribute to the curriculum and provide field knowledge through workshops, seminars, training courses, and lectures.
Program Objectives

To prepare graduates to perform structural analysis and Steel/RCC design of various structural systems.
To prepare students to manage industrial project and research work in the relevant domain

Program Outcomes

An ability to independently carry out research /investigation and development work to solve practical problems.
An ability to write and present a substantial technical report/document.
Demonstrate a degree of mastery over the area as per the specialization of the program i.e. Structural Engineering.

Career Prospects
Students of Civil engineering can get varied job opportunities like Building control surveyor, CAD technician, Consulting civil engineer, Contracting civil engineer, Design engineer, Site engineer, 
Structural engineer, Water engineer, etc
Placement
According to the data based on the year 2021-22, 11 students got placed and 3 students opted for higher studies.

Homecourse 








 








 


Curriculum 

		
                            DURATION:                2.5 Years




ENROLL NOW                


Student Activities





 







Categories
PG Programs 




The Civil Engineering Department offers a part-time M.Tech. program (Geotechnical Engineering) P.T., which runs for two and a half years. The curriculum covers foundation analysis and design, slope stability, earth retention, and construction features. Practical courses provide exposure to popular geotechnical software such as GEO5, Power GEOPAK, and ANSYS 11.0. The curriculum is designed by industry experts and academics who also happen to participate in regular workshops, seminars, training courses to provide practical knowledge to students.
Program Objectives

To prepare graduates to perform analysis and design of various geotechnical structures.
To prepare graduates to take up industrial project in the field of geotechnical engineering and allied area and also research work in the relevant domain.

Program Outcomes

An ability to independently carry out research / investigation and development work to solve practical problems.
Write and present a substantial technical report/document.
Demonstrate a degree of mastery over the area as per the specialization of the program i.e. geotechnical engineering.

Career Prospects
Students of Civil engineering can get varied job opportunities like Building control surveyor, CAD technician, Consulting civil engineer, Contracting civil engineer, Design engineer, Site engineer, 
Structural engineer, Water engineer, etc

M.Tech in Power Electronics & Power System


Homecourse 








 








 


Curriculum 

		
                            DURATION:                2 Years




ENROLL NOW                


Student Activities





 







Categories
PG Programs 




The Electrical Engineering department offers full-time post graduation course of four semesters. It follows the Choice Based Credit System (CBCS) and is regularly updated to include the latest industry developments in power electronics and power systems. The program offers industry-based projects and a year-long internship to improve student employability. Teaching and learning are student-centered, with laboratory and project activities designed to develop simulation, communication, hardware design, testing, and research skills. Moreover, students have the academic flexibility to choose their electives and projects. 
Program Objectives

 To enhance the technical and intellectual proficiency of students in Power Electronics & Power System, while fostering a passion for lifelong learning. 
To enable them to become proficient researchers, educators, and technocrats with innovative ideas for promoting sustainable development.

Program Outcomes

Carry out independent research/investigation and development work to solve practical problems.
Write and present a substantial technical report/document.
Demonstrate a degree of mastery over the area in Power Electronics and Power system.
Understand, analyze and design the electrical devices, power converters and control circuit for specific applications.
Develop and utilize modern tools for modeling, analyzing and solving various engineering problems related to power system.

Career Prospects
Opportunities for electrical engineers are wide open in various fields in industries related to electrical engineering including Telecommunication, Computer hardware, Networking, Automobile, Electric Vehicle, Automation Consumer goods sector, Power Stations, Electricity Transmission & Distribution utilities, Manufacturing plants, Plant Engineering, Industrial design & maintenance and many others. The curriculum is so design that the graduates can also decide to join IT/Software industries as a career option.

 M.tech in Robotics And Automation

M.Tech VLSI Design


Homecourse 








 








 


Curriculum 

		
                            DURATION:                2 Years




ENROLL NOW                


Student Activities





 







Categories
PG Programs 




The Electronics Engineering Department offers a two-year full-time M.Tech. program in VLSI Design. The curriculum is designed to teach students the complexities of contemporary Digital, Analog and RF system design, and Embedded systems using industry-standard EDA tools and platforms, including COMSOL Multiphysics, Mentor Graphics FPGA Advantage, Agilent ADS Design Suit, Tanner Tool, Keil MDK, Virtex 5 Development platform, and Embedded System Design environments. The program’s goal is to prepare graduates for employment in electronics engineering core, allied sectors, and entrepreneurship through hands-on training, core-elective courses, industry-oriented projects, and expert talks. 
Program Objectives

To develop graduates with an ability to design and analyze VLSI Systems.
To prepare graduates with necessary skills and knowledge of the discipline to excel in their career.
To encourage life-long learning with commitment to ethical practices.

Program Outcomes

An ability to acquire skills to interpret, analyze and evaluate problems pertaining to the discipline.
Apply knowledge of VLSI Design to solve engineering problems.
 Independently carry out research / investigation and development of work to solve socio -economic problems.
Write and present a substantial technical report /document.

Career Prospects
A master degree course in Electronics Design Technology enables students to enter into an Electronics Core fields as a design engineer or research scholars. EDT Graduate can work with public sectors, Telecom Industry, computer Hardware and Software Industry, Network Industry, Automation and Instrumentation Industry.

Masters in Industrial Engineering


Homecourse 








 








 


Curriculum 

		
                            DURATION:                2 Years




ENROLL NOW                


Student Activities





 







Categories
PG Programs 




Shri Ramdeobaba College of Engineering & Management has the distinction of offering first inter disciplinarily post graduate programme in Industrial Engineering in the year 2004. This Post Graduate programme has the available expertise of its core faculty supported by faculty of other departments and other engineering colleges. The programme functions with the state-of-the-art laboratories and close association with industries around. All the Post Graduate Projects are based on live problems faced by the industry.
Program Objectives

To prepare students to work in any engineering organization and undertake research work.
To ensure development of problem solving ability through the use of industrial engineering tools and software.
To encourage development of independent thinking and also the ability to work in teams through live projects undertaken in industry.

Program Outcomes 

Independently carry out research /investigation and development work to solve practical problems.
Write and present a substantial technical report/document.
Demonstrate a degree of mastery over the area as per the specialization of the program. The mastery should be at a level higher than the requirements in the appropriate bachelor program .

Career Prospects
Students can work as manufacturing technician, quality assurance inspector, industrial mechanic, industrial electrician, industrial designer, manufacturing production supervisor, supply chain analyst, etc.

 M.Tech in Geotechnical Engineering

M.tech in Robotics And Automation


Homecourse 








 








 


Curriculum 

		
                            DURATION:                2 Years




ENROLL NOW                


Infrastructure
Students And Activities





 







Categories
PG Programs 




M.Tech. in Robotics and Automation is a two year (4 Semester) full-time program offered by the Department of Mechanical Engineering. It is the first ever program in central India, offering the state of art technology encompassing digital advancement in Robotics & Automation.
(Eligibility for Admission:Min. 50% at UG level. in B.E/B.Tech)
Program Features

Industry oriented syllabus with special focus on experimental and activity based learning.
Expert faculty with PhD in relevant domain.
State-of-art laboratories well-equipped with modern hardware and high end softwares
RCOEM – TATA – CIIIT Center for Invention, Innovation, Incubation and Training
Academic flexibility to students to undertake full time internship or project in industry during third & fourth semester.
Focus on skill development & hands on training in Robotics & Automation practices.
Opportunity for internship with stipend and project work in industries.
Placement support and research-oriented projects for every student.
Tie up with industries for professional training on recent technologies.
Financial support & academic incentives for IPR & publishing research papers in reputed journals.

Program Objectives

To prepare students to apply the knowledge gained through independent and reflective learning to robotics, automation and allied multidisciplinary domains.
To prepare students to demonstrate the ability to use the modern tools related to knowledge base of Robotics and Automation.

Program Outcomes

Carry out independent research/investigation and development work to solve practical problems.
Write and present a substantial technical report/document.
Demonstrate a degree of mastery in the area of Robotics and Automation.

Career Prospects
Students can take up jobs in the field of Robotics and/or Automation such as Robotics Programmers, Robot Design Engineer, Robotics Test Engineers, Automated Product Design Engineer, Robotics System Engineer and Maintenance Engineers in manufacturing and service industry.
















Related Course




 M.Tech in Computer Science





 M.Tech in Geotechnical Engineering





 M.Tech in Power Electronics & Power System

M.Tech in Computer Science


Homecourse 








 








 


Curriculum 

		
                            DURATION:                2 Years (Full Time)




ENROLL NOW                


Students And Activities





 







Categories
PG Programs 




M. Tech. (Computer Science & Engineering) is a two year full time programme offered by CSE Department. The curriculum of the programme is revised on regular basis to meet the current industry requirement with the involvement of Industry experts. Workshops, seminars, training courses, lectures, etc. by industry experts are organized on regular basis to impart field knowledge. Programme offers one year internship with Stipend to improve the employability of students for all eligible students under various categories by competent authority.
Program Objectives

To develop professionals with an ability to apply knowledge of Computer Science in identifying, analyzing and formulating problems and designing their solutions.
To facilitate use of latest technologies and tools, multidisciplinary research and independent directed reflective learning.
To enable graduates in communicating effectively with the stakeholders, demonstrating professional ethics and engaging in lifelong learning for professional advancement.

Program Outcomes

 Understand the scope of problems through critical analysis with respect to the computing domain, propose algorithms and model efficient scalable systems.
Ability to augment domain knowledge by way of understanding effective methodologies and applying them to practice through experimentation.
 Apply techniques and tools in building reliable and maintainable software
Ability to engage in multidisciplinary research and collaborate towards accomplishing a common goal.
Ability to understand, design and develop software projects conforming specifications and budgetary constraints.

Career Prospects
RCOEM’s Computer Science & Engineering graduates have ample employment opportunities in various sectors such as software industries, IT-enabled service firms, research, communication, and the government sector. 
Placements
According to the latest data based on the year 2022-23, 12 students got placed in reputed companies. 
List of some of the leading companies participating in placement drive

Siemens

Homecourse 








 








 


Curriculum 

		
                            DURATION:                4 years




ENROLL NOW                


Phd Guidelines




 







Categories
PhD Program 




The Ph.D. program at RCOEM aims to foster research excellence and innovation in the engineering and management fields and prepare students for leadership roles in academia, industry, and beyond.
Eligibility:
 Candidates who have passed RTMNU PET/Equivalent exam as per RTMNU. 
Program Offered

 Department of Electronics Engineering
 Department of Electrical Engineering
 Department of Civil Engineering
 Department of Computer Science and Engineering
 Department of Mechanical Engineering
 Department of Management Technology (MBA)

Aim:
 Promote research among faculty and students, encourage interdisciplinary collaboration, connect with industry and universities, and establish RCOEM as a global R&D center.
Program Objectives

Our aim is to enhance research awareness by organizing a range of events, including national and international conferences, workshops on research methodology and patents, symposia, and guest lectures. 
We believe that faster collaboration and interaction among researchers working on disciplinary and interdisciplinary research is crucial. Therefore, we strive to foster such collaboration and encourage every faculty member to participate in research proposal writing and engage in R&D activities that can lead to a Doctoral degree.

R&D Activities

Organize guest lectures by eminent researchers from industry and academia.
Depute faculty members for higher studies and collaborative research to National and International institutes.
Extend project participation opportunities to faculty members and students funded and sponsored by apex bodies and organizations like UGC, CSIR, ICSSR, DRDO.
Faculty members actively engage in R&D activities including writing research proposals, publishing papers, presenting at conferences, organizing workshops and conferences.
Organize national level paper presentation contest for students.
Organize extra and co-curricular activities for students and faculty members

Examination Committee
Examination Committee 2022-23Institute has constituted Examination Committee as per direction no. 3 of 2016 issued by Rashtrsant Tukadoji Maharaj Nagpur University and the provision made in the XII Plan of U.G.C. guidelines for autonomous colleges. The examination committee consists of the following members:Sr. No.ProvisionNameDesignation1.The PrincipalDr. R. S. PandeChairman2.Three Regular Senior Faculty Members of the institute possessing teaching/research experience of more than Ten yearsDr. Mrs. Meghna HasamnisMemberDr. Avinash AgrawalMemberDr. Ashwin ChatpalliwarMember3.One Evaluation Expert nominated by the PrincipalDr. P.R. Naren, ACP School of Chemicals & Biotechnology, SASTRA Deemed University, Thanjavur, Tamil Nadu – 613401Member4.Controller of Examination, Sr. faculty member of Shri Ramdeobaba College of Engineering and ManagementDr. Abhijeet AgasheMember SecretaryExamination CommitteeExamination Cell will ensure:Conduction of comprehensive evaluation and assessment of students through Continuous Assessment and End Semester ExaminationsConduct of Free and Fair ExaminationsTimely and Error Free Declaration of ResultsTransparency in Evaluation ProcessSecrecy and Sanctity of the Examination processesPublication of Tabulation Registers and Gazette and issue of Grade Cards, Transcripts, Migration, Attempt/ Backlog and other Certificates to studentsFacilitation of issue of Degree Certificate to students by parent UniversityControl on mal-practices in assessment and evaluationInitiation and implementation of reforms in assessment and evaluation system to keep up with the changing times.
C.O.E.
He has been conferred with two Ph. D. Degrees, one in the field of Mechanical Engineering and the other in Business Management from Rashtrasant Tukadoji Maharaj, Nagpur University, Nagpur.Prior to this, he has done M. Tech in Industrial Engineering (First Merit) and MBA (Ninth Merit) from the same university. He is a Mechanical Engineering graduate. Dr. Agashe also holds Masters in Psychology, specializing in Counseling Psychology and a Post Graduate Diploma in International Business Operations from IGNOU. Dr. Agashe has more than 50 International and National Journal and Conference research papers to his credit.Dr. Abhijeet A. AgasheController of ExaminationsEmail: coe@rknec.eduHe is an Advanced Google Analytics certified by Google Analytics Academy. He has more than 16 years of experience in teaching, training, and research. He has represented India as a cultural ambassador to USA and Mexico under the Group Study Exchange Programme of Rotary International. He has been conferred with the ‘Distinguished Service Award’ for rendering excellent service for more than a decade by ‘Association of Indian Management Scholars’ (AIMS) International.

About CDPC
CAREER DEVELOPMENT & PLACEMENT CELL

Welcome to the Career Development and Placement Cell (CDPC) at RBU. Our job is to empower students with the skills, knowledge, and opportunities needed to excel in their professional careers. The CDPC serves as a vital link between the academic curriculum and the professional world, ensuring that students are well-prepared to meet the challenges of the job market.

We aim to facilitate holistic career development for our students by providing comprehensive resources, support, and guidance. We envision a future where every RBU graduate is equipped with the tools to achieve their career aspirations and contribute meaningfully to their chosen fields.

The success of CDPC is evident in the impressive placement records of our graduates. Each year, our students secure positions in prestigious companies across various sectors, contributing to their professional growth and the university’s reputation.
Key Amenities
At CDPC, we offer a range of amenities designed to enhance student employability and career readiness:

Counselling: Personalized sessions to help students identify their career goals and create actionable plans to achieve them.
Certification and Skill Development Workshops: Training in essential professional skills, including professional certifications in various domains, coding skills, resume writing, interview techniques, and communication.
Industry Interaction: Regular interactions with industry experts through guest lectures, seminars, and networking events.
Internship and Placement Drives: Facilitating internships and full-time job placements with leading companies.

 
Our Recruiters































































































































Placement Census
Placement Census
The Placement Census at RBU provides a quantitative snapshot of our placement activities and outcomes. This section is dedicated to presenting key statistics and data-driven insights that reflect the effectiveness of our placement strategies. It is an essential tool for understanding the overall performance of our placement initiatives. We have consistently achieved prolific placements through campus recruitment drives. Average placement for the last 10 years is more than 85%.

Yearly Highest Salary Offered (LPA)



Yearly Over All Students Engagement
 ( Placement + Higher Studies ) – Till May 2024




Highest Stipend Offered(Rs) Per Month 




Yearly Number of Students Going for Industry Internship – Till March 2024 




Total Number of Companies Visited in a Year – Till May 2024 


Placement Report
Placement Report


			The Placement Report is a comprehensive document that provides statistical data and qualitative insights the about placements. The placement season at RBU consistently demonstrates the high caliber of our students and the strong industry connections fostered by our Career Development and Placement Cell (CDPC). Each year, our students receive numerous job offers from leading companies, with top domestic salaries reaching impressive figures, reflecting the exceptional skills and preparedness of our graduates. Notable international job and internship offers highlight the global recognition our students achievements, further emphasizing the university’s commitment to producing world-class talent.



A considerable number of students receive high-value job offers, with many securing positions that offer salaries well above industry averages. The wide range of companies visiting our campus each year ensures diverse and plentiful opportunities for students across all disciplines.

Overall, the consistent success in placements at RBU is a testament to our commitment to academic excellence, comprehensive career development, and the strong, ongoing support of our industry partners.

Team CD&PC
RCOEM has proved to be the most favored destination for aspirant engineers from across the country. RCOEM has created many a placement records in the Maharashtra as well as Central India only to break them in the progressive years. Based on strong Industry-Academic interface, RCOEM happens to be setting new standards in campus placements. Year after year top notch companies are visiting RCOEM Campus for recruitment of fresh talent.The college has a full-fledged and well equipped Career Development & Placement Cell to fulfill the aspirations of the young graduate engineers and make them ready to take up challenging responsibilities of the corporate world.Dr. Parag JawarkarDean – CDPCDay to Day functioning of CD&PC is taken care by the Central Placement Co-Ordination Committee. Training Initiatives
Training InitiativesPlacement training initiatives at Ramdeobaba University are essential for preparing students to successfully navigate the competitive job market. These training programs bridge the gap between academic knowledge and industry expectations, enhance employability, and build essential skills. By investing in comprehensive placement training, RBU not only supports its students career aspirations but also strengthens its reputation and relationships with industry partners. The benefits of these initiatives are far-reaching, impacting students, the university, and employers positively. The training programs are categorized under four verticals, which are as follows:Employability Initiatives for StudentsCRT training – 4167 students trainedStudents from CSE, IT and circuit branches background have been exposed to various programming platforms like Hackerrank, Codeguru, Codechef, InterviewBit for the preparation for dream companies.Students are encouraged to participate in the various HACKATHONs and Company level competitions. 3 Teams out of 10 Teams of RBU that participated in Grand Finale of Smart India Hackathon 2019 have emerged WINNERS in “Complicated” Problem Statement CategoryOnline Practice Aptitude tests (50+ tests) were given to final and pre-final year students. All the tests made available were free and industry standard testsOther Industry level assessment provided to all to final and pre-final year students. Already 1600+ students have appeared for the test.Hundreds of students are registered for online MOOC Courses from UDACITY, UDEMY, COURSERA, SWAYAM, NPTEL, INFYTQ, EDX etc and are given credits in the academic scheme for the same.College has collaboration with AWS and a batch of 30 students is currently undergoing Cloud Solution Architect Certification Training and is expected to be certified by May 2019.Industry Offered Courses: – SalesForce, Mobile Computing, BI, IOT, internet and cyber security etc.
Milestones of CD&PC
Some Milestones of CD&PCThe Career Development & Placement Cell maintains round the year contact with the industries on one hand and provides all the training placements related support to the students throughout the year on the other hand. It regularly takes the feedback from the industries and analyses the performance of the students in the campus interviews and guides the students accordingly. T & P team nurture and grow old relationships and welcome new recruiters for a long-lasting and mutually beneficial relationship.Apart from organizing the campus recruitment drives the department also organizes career guidance seminars, campus preparation sessions, and training programs of the industries for the selected students, etc. It also provides support to the students for industrial training during their summer vacations.2022 Batch:246 offers Above 5 LPA29 Offers Above 10 LPA15 offers Above 15 LPA26 Offers Above 20 LPA2021 Batch :173 Offers Above 5 LPA21 Offers Above 8 LPA23 Offers Above 10 LPA13 Offers Above 18 LPA2020 Batch:223 Offers Above 5 LPA44 Offers Above 8 LPA27 Offers Above 10 LPA10 Offers Above 18 LPA2019 BatchThere is a qualitative shift which is witnessed by this batch with respect to higher packages as follows:168 Offers Above 5 LPA64 Offers Above 8 LPA40 Offers Above 10 LPA07 Offers Above 18 LPAThe Career Development & Placement Cell maintains round the year contact with the industries on one hand and provides all the training placements related support to the students throughout the year on the other hand. It regularly takes the feedback from the industries and analyses the performance of the students in the campus interviews and guides the students accordingly. T & P team nurture and grow old relationships and welcome new recruiters for a long-lasting and mutually beneficial relationship.Apart from organizing the campus recruitment drives the department also organizes career guidance seminars, campus preparation sessions, and training programs of the industries for the selected students, etc. It also provides support to the students for industrial training during their summer vacations.
Events / Activities
Training Initiatives 2022-23Webinar on “Higher Education Opportunities in Wayne State University, USA”Ms. Shraddha Singaurey, Recruitment Adviser – India, Office of International Programs, Wayne State University (WSU) delivered a webinar on 16 Feb 2021 to guide the students about the career opportunities in WSU, USA.Following topics were discussed during the webinar:College application process – changes that have taken place due to ongoing circumstances.How the campus has responded to COVID and how it is prepared to welcome new students for upcoming immediate intakes.The pandemic caused limited access to opportunities, how to build a strong application in this case.Wayne State University – Programs, scholarships offered, research and teaching assistantships.Guest lecture on “Big Data Analytics & Opportunities in SRH Hochschule Heidelberg, GermanyProf. Dr. Barbara Spric, Prof. Dr. Gerd Moeckel, and Prof. Dr. Ajinkya Prabhune, Faculty of SRH University Heidelberg, Germany delivered a lecture on Opportunities in Big data analytics on 2nd Dec 2019. During discussion with students, Prof. Dr. Barbara Spric have explained about their master’s program on Big data analytics, whereas Prof. Dr. Gerd Moeckel have explained about their master’s program in applied computer science. Prof. Dr. Ajinkya Prabhune discussed about their current projects, and requirements of man power in Industry. Total 64 students from the Institute have attended the lecture.Guest lecture on “Higher Education Opportunities in Wayne State University, USA”Ms. Shraddha Singaurey, Recruitment Adviser – India, Office of International Programs , Wayne State University (WSU) had visited our college on 27th Sep 2019 to guide the students about the career opportunities in WSU, USA.During discussion with students, She explained about various scholarships, tuition fees, total living cost, Internship and Job opportunities while pursuing M.S. Total 12 students from different branches attended the programme.Guest lecture on “Higher Education Opportunities in USA”Ms. Aditi Lele, Education USA, USIEF, Mumbai had delivered a lecture on “Higher Education Opportunities in US” on 24th Sep 2019. The topics that were covered during the presentation include the application process, selection of universities, how to construct a good application, and financial aid options. Total 21 students from different branches attended the programme.Guest lecture on “Higher Education Opportunities in RMIT University, Australia” Ms. Prabhali Mazumdar, Country Representative, RMIT, Australia had visited our college on 23rd Feb 2019 to guide the students about the career opportunities in RMIT, Australia.During discussion with students, She explained about various scholarships, tuition fees, total living cost, Internship and Job opportunities while pursuing M.S. Total 11 students from different branches attended the programme.Guest lecture on “Higher Education Opportunities in Wayne State University, US”Ms. Shreya Poddar, Manager, Education Client Engagement and In-Country Admission Coordinator (India) at WSU had visited our college on 15th Feb 2019 to guide the students about the career opportunities in WSU, US. She has delivered the way of writing Statement of purpose (SOP), criteria to get admission and also discussed about total expenses and scholarships at WSU. Total 32 students from different branches attended the programme.Guest lecture on “Higher Education Opportunities in Arizona State University, US”Mr. Deepraj Gahatraj, In-Country Admission Coordinator (India) at ASU had visited our college on 22nd Jan 2019 to guide the students about the career opportunities in ASU, US. Focus was on culture at ASU, Scholarships, Student internships, etc. Total 44 students from different branches attended the programme.Guest lecture on “Preparing Students Equipped with the State of Art Technologies with Appropriate Mix of Fundamentals”.In January 2018, Dr. Kanti Prasad [Professor/Founding Director, Microelectronics/VLSI Technology ,Electrical and Computer Engineering Department from University of Massachusetts Lowell] gave a guest lecture on “Preparing Students Equipped with the State of Art Technologies with Appropriate Mix of Fundamentals”. The main focus of his seminar was to strengthen the Engineering basics of the students i.e. to integrate fundamentals of Physics, Mathematics and Chemistry which must be included compulsorily in all State-of-the-Art courses. Engineering students who are product of such integrated curricula will never become obsolete. Guest lecture on “Preparing Students Equipped with the State of Art Technologies with Appropriate Mix of Fundamentals”. By Dr Kanti Prasad Under guidance cell for higher education (International) various activities are continuously conducted for motivating the students for MS abroad .The key foci of the cell is to provide complete guidance related to higher education in international universities, information related to exams like GRE, TOEFL, IELTS etc, writing SOP’s and LOR, Grade conversion etc depending upon the nature of University .Foreign language training is also imparted to students interested in foreign universities. The following events / activities were organized under this cell. Mr Rahul Batra –Antenna Design Engineer from Hirschman Car Communication, Germany gave a guest lecture on 23/12/2017 about German universities, career and study opportunities and life and culture in Germany.Mr Rahul Batra –Antenna Design Engineer from Hirschman Car Communication, Germany guest lecture for RCOEM students.On 30th January 2018 , Jenny Arkun [Country Manager –International Recruitment ] from University of Adelaide had visited RCOEM campus for “ Guest lecture on Higher Education opportunities in University of Adelaide” and around 35 students participated in the event . The event was organized by Guidance Cell for Higher Education –international under IQAC, RCOEM.Jenny Arkun [Country Manager –International Recruitment ] University of Adelaide addressing RCOEM students.French Delegates from the Consulate were also invited for “Guest lecture on higher education opportunities in France”. Dr. Mrs. Sandrine Maximilien [Attachée for Science and Technology] and Ms Gaelle Lenhardt [Manager Campus France Indore ] from French Embassy briefed the students about – Summer programs, Mobility Exchange, short stay option, Scholarship programs etc . In India there are around 1000 plus French companies [like Renault Kiwi, Minatec, Robot Rosa etc] , scientific and R &D institutes [like Solvay ,Loreal etc] and scholarships [like Eiffel Scholarship and Raman and Charpak Scholarships etc]. They also encouraged the students to take international certification for French language from “Alliances Francaises” which provides French courses, official French exams (recognized by the French Ministry of Education). Campus France is a desk for students who aspire for higher studies in France, cafeteria, translations, tour of the city and any advice related to French speaking countries etc. Even after an hour full of interesting information, RCOEM students were ready for more and came up with lot of queries. The event was organized by Guidance Cell for Higher Education –international under IQAC, RCOEM. Dr. Mrs. Sandrine Maximilien [Attachée for Science and Technology] presents higher education opportunities in France Dr. Mrs. Sandrine Maximilien and Ms Gaelle Lenhardt interact with students.DAAD –Deutscher Akademischer Austauschdienst visits RCOEM :February 28th 2018The Representatives of German Academic Exchange Service (DAAD) – Devi Arand, Honorary Director along with Dhanashree Deodhar, Information and Office Manager had visited the college on 28th February 2018 for a guest Lecture to guide the students about the career, study and research opportunities in Germany. They discussed in brief the education system for Masters in Germany which comprises of technical universities (TU9) and Fach-hochschulen. TU9 universities mainly focus on R&D while Fach-hochschulen are industry-oriented. The public universities mostly waiver the tuition fees while private universities may charge from 500 to 5000 Euros. The students were very interactive and some were also in process of applying to German universities. The session was indeed very informative! Higher Education Cell
Higher Education Cell – International (UG & PG)         Prof. Sangita H. Deshmukh : 8275045636email: hec@rknec.edu Students of RCOEM are highly ambitious and after graduation many of them apply to foreign universities for Master’s Program. The college has a record breaking list of alumni’s who have pursued higher education from top universities of the world. To support this venture of students, college provides best possible guidance to students aiming for higher education from foreign universities. Students are provided complete counselling including university short-listing, Statement of Purpose preparation, Documents preparations, VISA documentation and VISA interview preparation.Students also apply to partner universities (Universities having MOU with RCOEM) and the cell aims at fetching the best possible option for students in terms of financial aid and admission acceptance. The international collaboration and higher education cell has various objectives that includes arranging students visits/exchange programmes at partner universities, faculty interaction/interchange programmes, organization of joint international conferences, collaborative research work for faculty members and exploring higher education and scholarship options for RCOEM students.Students willing to pursue Higher Studies / Research Internship will register for the same. Aim is to guide, forward Information and resources to students. Also, aims to create a network of students applying for the same universities.

Industry Initiatives
1) Infocepts Skills Upliftment Elective Course● The Career Development and Placement cell of Shri Ramdeobaba College of Engineering and Management had initiated a skills upliftment program with the most emerging technology in the industries in collaboration with Infocepts under the guidance of Dr. Parag Jawarkar, Training & Placement Officer.● In this program 133 of students were trained in the field of Business Intelligence, Big Data & Data Science by the Industry professionals of the company.● InfoCepts is a global leader of end-to-end data & analytics solutions with nearly 20 years’ experience.● Infocepts’ Skills Upliftment Program is a 32 hours elective course for those students who wish to pursue their careers in the field of Data Science and Analytics. Students of Electronics, Electronics and Communication & Electronics and Design Technology were eligible.● The course started with an online Introduction session on 20th June 2022 where students were introduced with the technical team and were briefed about the course.● The course began on 21st June 2022 and covered the following Modules:○ Big Data & Cloud○ Analytics & BI○ Data Science● Infocepts also hosted their last 2 sessions in their campus, where the students were shown the campus and worked on a live project. The course was concluded on 12th July.● The course completion offline test was scheduled on 2nd August in the college premises. 133 Students appeared for the test.2) Digital Nurture by Cognizant● “Digital Nurture 2.0“ is a transformative training and recruitment approach for students while they are in their 6th semester, which will enable them to grab a GenC Next role with Cognizant and work in niche technologies.● The program gives students an opportunity to grab premium roles with Cognizant to accelerate their career path.● It is an 18 monthstudent bootcamp which offers certifications in courses like AWS Cloud Computing, Salesforce and Cybersecurity which are the leading requirements of today’s market. These certifications were provided to make students eligible to appear for higher band salaries. This engagement and exposure to third year students ensured a channelized path for their placement preparation.3) Persistent Systems ‘Martian’ Program● Martian is a program carved out for engineering students to smoothen their journey from campus to corporate. This is a 5 week program where Persistent System aims to equip students with the current practices on technology fronts so that they can acquire deeper knowledge along with its practical applications to make them eligible for pre-placement offers from Persistent Systems.● A pre-qualifier online assessment was conducted for the registered students along with a program orientation. Students who qualified the test had to go through a rigorous 5 weeks Summer Internship cum training module in the field of Operating System, Computer Networks, DBMS, OOPs, Data Structures & Algorithm.● A Martian Post Internship Online Assessment test was conducted for the students who successfully completed the training and cleared the assignments given during the training.● After clearing the post internship test students were shortlisted for the Technical & HR Interviews.4) Persistent Systems ‘Polaris’ ProgramPolaris is a specialized training program on Salesforce. This is a 4-to-6-week program where Persistent System trains the students with the current practices on Salesforce technology. Various packages are offered to the successful candidates through this training by Persistent Systems.
Career Counselling
Career Counselling CellThe Career Counselling and Guidance Cell in Colleges has been formulated to address the diverse socio-economic challenges and geographic backgrounds of the heterogeneous population of students coming to the Colleges vis-à-vis equity of access and placement opportunities through availability of appropriate institutional support information. Linguistic differences and cultural gaps among students also call for the setting up of placement cells. Availability of relevant and accessible information coupled with professional guidance to utilize the same can result in better career achievements outside the classrooms and help in the healthy progression of students.College is delivering relevant information on courses and combinations on offer with freedom of choice is generally available and counselling is informally given as a support service. The conventional information system comprises a copy of prospectus that contains a list of courses and combinations, entry rules, fee structure, examination schedule etc. in a routine repetitive manner year after year.But now with the change in scenario, not only the academic content and its rules have become oriented towards the market needs but one has also to address social disparities and career opportunities that education has to offer. The conventional information system is now to be supplemented with active guidance and information technology that is fast replacing the print media with a system that can quickly retrieve information details for the benefit of all concerned. Now it is important to institutionalize this support to enhance the reach and scope of available opportunities for the students and prepare them for the future challenges.To implement the above, Counselling Services are to be formalized which will enable the students to get over their social institutions and exclusivity, which are attributed to their socio-economic and cultural diversities and linguistic barriers. The career and counselling support that an institution offers to its students makes them confident to perform better. Counselling thus addresses both the academic and the career concerns and opportunities. The inculcation of guidance about market patterns and employability can help the institution in building a base for its students. This exercise will result in their socioeconomic integration.Career Counselling and Guidance Cell would help the students with appropriate guidance to establish linkages with the world of work and locate career opportunities vis- à-vis the realities and job profiles in the context of highly competitive emerging occupational patterns. The gap in perception about the market demands and individual expectations could be bridged through psychological and confidence building measures.Vocational guidance and campus based interviews have become a common practice. These could be taken care of through the active liaison of the Career and Counselling Cell with the recruiting agencies and HR personnel of reputed firms. The active participation of institutional experts from these could give greater on site experience in search of suitable candidates. In this exercise, the institutions, for positive help, could also involve their alumni. They could also undertake an affordable training programme to acquaint the students with the high demand market areas and invoke industry institution linkage. Objective:Along with the academic and administrative processes in a College, Career and Counselling Cell has to be a dispensation of well-informed and interested teachers.It has to support the students in the development of soft skills and communication ability to challenge the rigors of competitive tests and on-job-training in add-on or vocational courses.As a purveyor of healthy inter and intra personal relations, it has to inculcate social values and ability to think independently for carrying out social responsibilities.There may be a team of teachers with different subjects and interests to create a homogeneous group to translate this vision and carry out its healthy functions as an institutional imperative.The guidance and counselling cell in a College has to be a resource centre of information, guidance and counselling with free accessibility and internet based global connectivity and exchange of information on professional placements. Function of Career Counselling Cell:To gather information on job avenues and placements in different institutions and concerns related to the courses that the College offers.To analyse information in the local, regional and national contexts to explore its relevance and utility for the students in their placements and on-job training.To organise seminars and guidance workshops for informing students about the emerging professional trends and events, job profiles, leadership roles, entrepreneurship, market needs and risks and implementation of national socioeconomic policies and to impart training in soft skills. To promote discipline, healthy outlook and positive attitudes towards national integration and removal of narrow provincial preferences and prejudices

Homefaculties 








 










 





Adnan Ali
HOD

Business Programme 




 










Vision
To continually improve the education environment, in order to develop graduates with strong academic and technical background needed to achieve distinction in the discipline. The excellence is expected in various domains like workforce, higher studies or lifelong learning. To strengthen links between industry through partnership and collaborative development works.
Mission
To develop strong foundation of theory and practices of computer science amongst the students to enable them to develop into knowledgeable, responsible professionals, lifelong learners and implement the latest computing technologies for the betterment of the society.
Salient features of Department
The Department of Computer Science & Engineering was established in 2002, is well-equipped with state-of-the-art infrastructure.
The department established RCOEM-NVIDIA Center of Excellence for Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Deep Learning and Data Analytics that promotes high-end computing through Open Source technologies and hosts NVIDIA DGX DL Workstation.
The department has received a project grant of INR 1.03 crores in association with CSIR-Central Institute of Mining and Fuel Research (CIMFR), Nagpur Research Centre (Fuel Sciences).
The department laboratories are well equipped with hardware and firmware in line with the current trends for development of projects in varied domains like, IoT, Robotics and networking.
The department is involved in innovative practices that resulted in students winning awards for projects of social relevance viz., USD 5000 in Data Streamr Challenge, USD 3500 in Biconomy HackMoney and many more.
The department motivates and guides the students to excel in National and International Events like Smart India Hackathon and ICPC resulting in 4 teams winning the Smart India Hackathon from 2019 to 2022 and 2 teams winning a prize money of Rs. 1 lakh each in 2022. Over 8 teams have also represented the college in regionals of ICPC.
The department has MOUs with companies like Infosys, Persistent, Accenture, GlobalLogic India Pvt. Ltd., Infocepts that have resulted in acquiring the required support and training on the latest software products which has helped in bridging the gap between institution and industry.
The department provides a platform to actively contribute to get through the challenges by CodeChef, HackerRank, HackerEarth, Geeks Coding to name a few.
Students are encouraged to appear for GATE, CAT, GRE and other competitive examinations and opt for higher studies from highly ranked universities in the field of Engineering and Management.
The department is involved in providing guidance to research interns facilitating student publications in reputed journals.
The department also nurtures extra-curricular skills of students to get recognized at state, national and inter-national levels.

Welcome to Students' Section
 



 The invaluable process of clarifying values and goals can keep the college students focused on their paths towards Achievements. The important first step of charting a course through college and in life is defining your values. A college student may value their grades, their future, relationship building, their health, their community, the world and many other things all at time. The weight to which they assign all of these values is what will help them priorities their time and set productive goals.RCOEM emphasizes upon Simple living and high thinking with discipline in life.All the students at RCOEM have to abide by the code of conduct. RCOEM is Ragging Free and has various committees and cells like Disciplinary committee, Anti ragging committee, Cell against sexual harassment and gender violation etc.

Faculty


Home 






















Welcome to Faculty Section 











 Faculty, Non Teaching staff, Administrators, Management – as well as our students – each have have their part to play in flexible, improvisational composition of the RCOEM community, but the key to this model is that faculty must be active leaders and participants in the change. The individual achievements of faculty members are paramount to any educational institution’s success, but the work that they do as members of RCOEM community is equally vital in creating the benefits that technical education brings to our society.We already accept this basic principle of collaboration. The value of a collaborative faculty leadership also extends to the learning experience of students, and, as with translational work and research collaboration, these efforts work best through interdisciplinary interactions such as team teaching, curriculum design and the innovative use of active learning pedagogies.

Registrar


Home 






















Registrar 











 Dr. Sanjay B. Bodkhe presently serving as Registrar (In-charge) of RBU and Professor in the Department of Electrical Engineering has a distinguished academic background of over 33 years with industry experience. He completed his PhD from VNIT Nagpur in Electric Drives and has taught/supervised numerous UG, PG and PhD students. He has published more than sixty research papers in various journals and conference proceedings and has two patents granted to his credit. He has also authored three textbooks for the students of electrical engineering. During his career, he has worked in various capacities like, Dean Academics, Chairman BoS, Head of Department, NBA Coordinator, NAAC Coordinator, IQAC Member Secretary, and has performed a leading role in the establishment and operationalization of the university.Prof. Bodkhe was awarded two MODROBS grants and one Research Grant (RPS) by AICTE, New Delhi. He was appointed as Peer Team Member by National Board of Accreditation (NBA) and has visited many colleges on behalf of NBA. He was also appointed as Moderator by Maharashtra Public Service Commission (MPSC) and as Member on Model Curriculum Development Committee (in line with NEP 2020) by the Government of Maharashtra. Dr. Bodkhe has delivered numerous guest lectures in various institutes on different topics that include, NEP-2020, Outcome Based Education, Accreditation, Research Methodology and Electrical Drives. He is recognized and nominated as Member/Expert on various bodies like Research Recognition Committee, Academic Council and Boards of Studies of many other institutes and universities.Dr. Bodkhe is the Fellow of Institute of Engineers (India) and has affiliations with other professional bodies like IEEE and ISTE. He believes to maintain student-centric approach and academic standards aligned to industry needs, innovation, and multi-disciplinary ecosystem in different processes of the university. His teaching and research areas of interest are electrical machines, drives, EV and renewable energy. 







  



Dr. Sanjay B. Bodkhe
 











Email: registrar@rknec.edu
