About Programme
(L to R) Satyanarayan Nuwal, Chairman, RCOEM, Ar. Abhishek Deshpande, former CJI Sharad Bobde, Padma Vibhushan Sudarshan Sahoo, Pushpa Sahoo, Dr. Rajesh Pande, Principal, RCOEM during their recent meeting with President Droupadi Murmu at Rashtrapati Bhawan, New Delhi.Programme Details     Sthapatya Veda is a 11 month foundation course part time programme offered by Civil Engineering Department. The programme started in year 2023 with the intake of 120 students. The curriculum of the programme is to set an equilibrium of Cosmic Powers based on Nature’s Law within a dwelling structure. The curriculum broadly cover planning and construction of Apartment to Airport while Tower to Township as well as recreational places as per Sutra Mandala Siddhanta by Sthapatya Veda.Sthapatya Veda is the language of Architecture. It is the most ancient and complete system of architecture and city planning in accord with Natural Law, which takes into account the mathematics, yoga sutra, Quantum Physics and planetary and Earth Science. The difference between Sthapatya Veda and Vastu Shastra is One is Engineering, the other is Science. Engineering is the applied aspect, Science is the theoretical aspect. The term Sthapatya Veda refers to the is the applied aspect of this precious knowledge, while the term Vastu refers to the theoretical aspect. Veda means knowledge, and Sthapan means to establish. Therefore as we already mentioned, Sthapatya Veda is the Science of Architecture. Sthapatya Veda is the knowledge of application and skills.
Key Features
                                           कालः सृजति भूतानि कालः सम्हरति प्रजाः ।                                          सर्वे कालस्य वशगाः कालो तस्य वशे स्थितः ।।The above lines mean that Time creates material objects of nature. All objects created are destroyed by time. Everything rests in the hands of time. But that time rests with the ultimate – Energy or God.     Time creates everything and time destroy everything so Sthapatya Veda a medium to connect human being with time. Mahamuni Mayan invented this theory and explain in Sthapatya Veda. By designing proper sutra of space and material can connect with time this interpreted in Sthapatya Veda.                          Sthapatya Veda , An upaveda of ATHARVA VEDA……                                   ऋग्यजुः सामाधर्वाख्यान् वेदान् पूर्वादिभिर्मुरवैः। शास्त्रमिज्यां स्तुतिस्तोमं प्रायश्चित्तं व्यधात्क्रमात्।।                                               आयुर्वेदं धनुर्वेदं गान्धर्व वेदमात्मनः। स्थापत्यं चासृजद् वेदं क्रमात्पूर्वादिभिर्मुखैः ।।                                                 इतिहास पुराणानि पञ्चमं वेदमीश्वरः। सर्वेभ्य एव वक्त्रेभ्यः ससृजे सर्वदर्शन्र्र्रः ।।Veda Vyasa’s Bhāgavata, makes mention of Sthapatya Vedam as one of the Vedas that emerged from the land of Bharat in the remote past. It also makes mention of another Veda – Pranava Veda – that existed earlier to other Vedas such as Rig, Yajus, Sama, Atharva and also Ayurveda, Dhanurveda, Gandharva Veda and Sthapatya Veda.Ayurveda is a science of medicine and its legendaries are Charaka, Sushruta etc.Dhanurveda is a science of military warfare and its masters are Arjun, Ashwathama etc.Gandharva Veda is a science of Art and Drama and its legendaries are Kavi Kalidas, Devarshi Narada.Sthapatya Veda is a science of architecture that combines with Mathematics, Yoga Sutra, Quantum Physics and Planetary and Earth Science.Sthapatya Veda was established as a language of architecture by Mayan. Mahamuni Mayan     Mahamuni Mayan was the progenitor of Sthapatya Veda teachings. “He is considered as the Divine architect, scientist, technical wizard, poet and traditional builder, by name Mahamuni Mayan”     In ancient scriptures, Mayan or Mayasura was a great ancient king of the asuras, daityas and rakshasa races. Mayan was known for his brilliant in architecture. In Mahabharata, Mayasabha – the Hall of Illusions – was named after him. Mayan is credited with the authorship of the Mayamatama Sthapatya Veda, the Surya Siddhanta. स्थपतिलक्षणम्स्थपतिः स्थापनार्हः स्यात् सर्वशास्त्र विशारदः । न हीनाङ्गोऽतिरिक्ताङ्गो धार्मिकस्तु दयापरः ।।अमात्सर्योऽनसूयश्च तन्द्रितस्त्वभिजातवान् । अगणितज्ञः पुराणज्ञः सत्यवादी जितेन्द्रियः ।।चित्रज्ञस्सर्व देशज्ञश्रानन्दात्मा अलुब्धकः । अरोगी चाप्रमादीच सप्तम्पसनवर्जितः ।।सुनामादृढबुद्धिश्च्र्र्र्र वास्तुविद्याब्धि पारगः ।। Sthapati, one who owns skills and knowledge of Sthapatya Veda…….      Sthapati is not only but also… an expert of the design of structure though he must have crossed ‘the ocean of the science of architecture’. He needs to be balanced in body and mind and be nicely-versed in the all the traditional sciences in its numerous branches. He should have an urge and compassion about innovations. He should have expertise in the history of the land and a good draftsman who has sharp be widely travelled.     The Sthapati should be sensitive, soft-hearted, free from envy and not envied by others. He should be good-looking and free from physical deformity, straightforward, able to control senses, clarity of mind, free from greed, free from diseases, unblemished character and free seven types of vices. He must be alert about performance and be strong-willed.     Vedic texts on the traditional Indian system of Architecture. These texts describe principles of design, layout, measurement, ground preparation, space management and spatial Geometry….     Disproportion plan forms in contemporary architecture agitate and spoil an alignment of energies and forces, therefore disallowed in the design of living spaces while Sthapatya Veda being a science of Architecture has completely based on Nature’s law and complete solution to control balance in life….  Interpretation of Sthapatya Veda by non-scientific scholars versed in Sanskrit and astrology unable to offer scientific solutions in Architecture. Due to that it lost its scientific importance and allows complex theories of mysticism under the label of Vastu shastra….     Need to learn and interpret the principles of Sthapatya Veda in a scientific manner with today’s Architectural pattern. That’s why need to set up a universal research institution to reinstate Sthapatya Veda as a worldwide system for planning and construction. That will encourage replacing contemporary architecture with Sthapatya Veda as a global language of architecture….      MAYAN would be first and most unique Research Institution has been based on Sthapatya Veda. Sthapatya Veda is an ancient system of knowledge that involves the connection between people and the buildings in which they live and work….  The research in Sthapatya Veda attempt to find out solution on how to apply sutra Mandal Siddhanta in modern living in a sequel title applied in modern architecture….     Sthapatya Veda use for better life with the people around inhabitant. It promotes internal peace and calm and it can also promote mutual relationship among the inhabitant that live inside the structure. It is believed to bring in harmony and aimed towards illustrate positive cosmic energy into inhabitant….     Mayan foundation is an initiative to provide informal education about Sutra Mandal Siddhanta, a model and an extract of all designing principles from Sthapatya Veda for inhabitants’ health, wealth, power and prosperity. The area’s power and prosperity can be passed on to the next generation of inhabitant…..      Architect Abhishek unravelled some of the mysteries behind rule as per Sthapatya Veda in places like Shahjahanabad, Lutyen’s Delhi, London, and the Vatican. India enjoyed purity and prosperity during Mughal Empire, Shahjahanabad. India struggling with extreme poverty throughout colonial rule. The British Empire stretched over 13 million square miles across several continent. Vatican most powerful religious/spiritual establishment on earth.Shahjahanabad , a city of Monarchs……Lutyen’s Delhi , An epicenter of Indian unrest …..London, The Sun never sets on the British Empire….Vatican , a nerve centre of biggest Religious -Spiritual- Financial Power since Centuries …..
Programme Scheme
 

Course Director
After GraduationArchitect Abhishek learned extremely precious knowledge of Sthapatya Veda – a Vedic Architecture, Quranic verses, and Biblical verses.Architect Abhishek mastered thousands of Sutras in Sthapatya Veda.Architect Abhishek an eminent Sthapati and Spiritual Engineer.Architect Abhishek a scholar of Science of Architecture and Spirituality – the Engineering of the Divine, and an instructor of this Indian Science and Technology.Architect Abhishek revived this Ancient knowledge and implemented it in the real world in respect to the current context.Architect Abhishek was appointed as a Sthapatya Veda consultant by RSS Supremo to redesign its Nagpur headquarter       He has started his research and analysis on Sthapatya Veda in 2003 under the guidance of Dr. Brahma Deo Upadhyay (then Vice Chancellor of Maharishi Mahesh Yogi University, Holland).     In 20 years of his architectural experience he has studied many architectural structures and decoded thousands of sutras in Sthapatya Veda. He also worked on correcting and implementing them successfully.     Interpretation of Sthapatya Veda by non-scientific scholars versed in Sanskrit and astrology was unable to offer scientific solutions in Architecture. As a result, he is taking the initiative to offer informal education about the Sthapatya Veda in the simplest form to architects and engineers. Shri Ramdeobaba College of Engineering and Management is introducing the Sthapatya Veda course for the first time in India. Course Co-ordinatorAr. Nikita Niwal SakhareAfter completing her B.Arch. in 2017, Nikita joined Ar. Abhishek Deshpande in 2018 as a Sutragrahi with a background in architectural concept designing and planning.She acquired to possess the general knowledge of Sthapatya Veda.She learn Sutra Mandal Siddhanta skills from Ar. Abhishek and apply skills in several projects together.She also presents the content which reflects the principles of Sthapatya Veda.
Achievement
 (L to R) Dr. Rajesh Pande, Principal, RCOEM, Ar. Abhishek Deshpande, former CJI Sharad Bobde, during their recent meeting with President Droupadi Murmu at Rashtrapati Bhawan, New Delhi  Padma Vibhushan Sir. Ratan Tata with Mayan Ar. Abhishek Deshpande discussed in respect of Sthapatya Veda and give blessing to acquiescence.  Mayan Ar. Abhishek Deshpande with Pujya Sri Sri Ravi Shankar discussed as concerns the design of a 360-acre Art of Living Centre according the Sthapatya Veda.  Mayan Ar. Abhishek Deshpande with Hon’ble ex-chief justice of India Mr. Justice Sharad Bobade Sir dialogue about the re-design of his own residence at Nagpur as per the Sthapatya Veda.  Mayan Ar. Abhishek Deshpande visited Acharya Swami Avdheshanand Giri ashram and provided some recommendation as per Sthapatya Veda. Swami Ji also give blessing for the Sthapatya Veda course.  Dr. Chandra Prakash Dwiwedi (Chanakya) blessed to Ar. Abhishek Deshpande with respect to Sthapatya Veda course.

About Swayam


Home 






















  Government InitiativeMinistry of Human Resource Development, Government of India has initiated an indigenous project called SWAYAM ‘Study Webs of Active Learning for Young Aspiring Minds’, which hosts ‘Massive Open Online Courses’ MOOCs. The SWAYAM platform has been conceived to provide access to the quality e-learning/Online-learning resources across the country.SWAYAM is a programme initiated by Government of India and designed to achieve the three cardinal principles of Education Policy viz., access, equity and quality.The objective of this effort is to design and take the best teaching learning resources to all, including the most disadvantaged and make them able to join the mainstream of the knowledge economy.In order to ensure that, the best quality content is produced and delivered, 9 National Coordinators have been appointed under SWAYAM. They are: AICTE, NPTEL, UGC, CEC, NCERT, NIOS, IGNOU, IIMB, NITTTR.To know more visit : http://swayam.gov.in

 HighlightsRCOEM positioned in the 151-200 Rank band of Engineering Category and 51-200 Rank band in Innovation Category by National Institutional Ranking Framework 2023.RCOEM has got INDIA RANKING ‘146’ by National Institutional Ranking Framework 2022.RCOEM has got INDIA RANKING ‘119’ by National Institutional Ranking Framework 2021.RCOEM has got 20th rank in India Today Ranking 2021 in All India Private Engineering Colleges CategoryRCOEM Centers of Excellence :RCOEM-TATA-CIIIT Center of Invention, Innovation, Incubation and Training.NVIDIA – Center of Excellence in the area of “Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning”.Centre for Microsystems with IntellisenseEnergy Research Centre (ERC)RCOEM-QCFI Centre of Human Excellence.RCOEM has been ranked 26th as per CSR Magazine Survey 2020RCOEM has got 50th rank in India Today Ranking 2020 in All India Private Engineering Colleges CategoryRCOEM has been ranked 28th in Outlook’s India’s Best Professional Colleges 2020 Survey.RCOEM-TATA-CIIIT Center of Invention, Innovation, Incubation and Training was inaugurated at the hands of Honourable Union Minister Shri Nitin Gadkari.RCOEM has got INDIA RANKING ‘113’ by National Institutional Ranking Framework 2020.RCOEM signed a Memorandum of Understanding for clinical collaboration with Kingsway Hospitals in the field of Bio-Medical Engineering.Ramdeobaba College of Engineering and Management is a authorised partner institute of “Study in India” an initiative by the Ministry of HRD, Government of India for the admission cycle of 2019-2020. The Ministry of Human Resources Development (HRD) has approved ‘Study in India’ programme to attract foreign students to pursue higher education in India.RCOEM is known for excellent and well qualified faculty. College boasts of 134 faculty members who hold doctorate that is Ph.D degree in their respective subjects. Students are groomed under the expert guidance of the faculty members in academic and co-curricular areas.RCOEM has got INDIA TODAY RANKING of 23 in All India Private Engineering Colleges Category.RCOEM ranked ’27th‘ among all Private Engineering Colleges of India as per Outlook survey 2019. AND ranked ’53rd‘ among all Engineering Colleges of India as per Outlook survey 2019.RCOEM has got INDIA RANKING ‘112’ by National Institutional Ranking Framework 2019.RCOEM hosted the 1 st , 2 nd and 3 rd Smart India Hackathon in 2017, 2018, 2019 respectively organized by Ministry of HRD, Govt. of India.RCOEM has got INDIA RANKING in the range of ‘101-150’ by National Institutional Ranking Framework 2018.RCOEM has got INDIA RANKING ‘64‘ by National Institutional Ranking Framework 2017.RCOEM ranked 49 th in Outlook’s India’s Best Professional Colleges 2017 Survey.Approved Autonomous status By UGC as well as by RTM Nagpur University.Approved by All India Council of Technical Education (AICTE) and affiliated to Nagpur University, Nagpur.RCOEM has been awarded “A” Grade by NAAC for a period of 5 years from Dec,2014.NBA accredited Engineering departments, including NBA-tier I accreditation for five years.World-class sporting facilities at New Campus, Mohali, Katol Road, Nagpur.Many faculty members have brought laurels to the institute by way of awards, honours and prizes at National and International level.RCOEM won the KC Bajaj Trophy for Best College in Sports Promotion from Sports Journalist Association of Nagpur and Raisoni Achievers in Annual Award 2016.MoUs with highly reputed International Universities of USA, UK, and Australia.Implementation of Choice Based Credit System (CBCS) for PG Programmes since 2016-17 academic session.RCOEM has earned the distinction of having highest placements in Maharashtra and it is the most sought after Technical Institute in Central India.RCOEM has been selected as the top institution in Maharashtra by Rajiv Gandhi Science and Technology Commission for the implementation of scheme of Technology Information, Forecasting, and Assessment Council (TIFAC), by RGSTC, Govt. of Maharashtra and MSME Internship scheme for the consecutive second year..Ongoing consultancy of more Rs 1 Crore received under MoUs signed with 30 industries.RCOEM was selected as the top institution in Maharashtra by RGSTC for the implementation of scheme of Technology Information, Forecasting, and Assessment Council (TIFAC), by Rajiv Gandhi Science and Technology Commission (RGSTC), Government of Maharashtra.Incorporation of dynamic TBI Foundation, a Section 8 Company founded by College to give momentum to innovation, entrepreneurship and incubation support related activities.Implemention of Vishvesharaya PhD Scheme of Department of Electronics and Information Technology (DeitY).RCOEM selected as Knowledge Management Partner Institution (KMPI) of Consultancy Development Centre (CDC), DSIR (Dept of Scientific and Industrial Research), Government of India.Highest Placements in Central India.RCOEM compete with the likes of IITs and top government and non-government educational institutions as well as well-established consultancy firms of India to attain this milestone.Over 500 students have done or are doing their MS from prestigious institutes in USA and UK.RCOEM students excel in competitive examinations like CAT, GRE, GMAT, CET, GATE etc and Students after graduation have been admitted to reputed institutions as IIT’s, IISc-Bangalore, BITS-Pilani, VJTI and various Regional Engineeing Colleges.Shri Ramdeobaba College Engineers for Environment Forum (REEF) of RCOEM is the recipient of Earthian Award-2015.Established in 1984, one of the oldest institutes of the central India.Institute level Admissions (Management quota) on merit and transparent basis.RCOEM has received grants of more than 2 crore rupees from various Government agencies such as Department of Science & Technology (DST), Department of Information Technology (DIT), AICTE etc. for conducting research activities.Well Placed Alumni. Strong tie with Alumni. The alumni association is giving scholarship to bright students in addition to Tuition fee Waiver scheme of Institute. Association also donates technical education aid.Vibrant Entrepreneurship Development Cell (OASIS) and Business Incubation Centre (First Step).As per the compulsory internship scheme of the curriculum, MCA final semester students are working as interns in reputed firms to ensure guaranteed placements.Former students have been selected in Civil Services, Engineering Services, etc.

Students at Other Universities for Higher Education


International Collaborations
International CollaborationsWith globalization and increasing need for international exposure to academia, RCOEM has forged ties with various universities of USA, UK and other countries. The primary aim of these collaborations is to foster advancement in teaching, research and academic collaboration and to create avenues for enhancing student and faculty experience, enhanced employability with development of curriculum, practical approach, soft skill development and creativity. The collaborations aim to achieve these through development of short term programs, sharing of best practices, innovative or creative concepts, and student and faculty exchange. Collaborative development of teaching and research methodology and continued education programs are also part of the collaboration.Current Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) with Foreign UniversitiesPast Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) with Foreign UniversitiesUniversity of Cumbria (UK)London School of Training (UK)University of District of Columbia (USA)University of Hartford (USA)North Umbria University (UK)Deakin University (Australia)
Events /Activities
Webinar on “Higher Education Opportunities in Wayne State University, USA”Ms. Shraddha Singaurey, Recruitment Adviser – India, Office of International Programs, Wayne State University (WSU) delivered a webinar on 16 Feb 2021 to guide the students about the career opportunities in WSU, USA.Following topics were discussed during the webinar:College application process – changes that have taken place due to ongoing circumstances.How the campus has responded to COVID and how it is prepared to welcome new students for upcoming immediate intakes.The pandemic caused limited access to opportunities, how to build a strong application in this case.Wayne State University – Programs, scholarships offered, research and teaching assistantships.Guest lecture on “Big Data Analytics & Opportunities in SRH Hochschule Heidelberg, GermanyProf. Dr. Barbara Spric, Prof. Dr. Gerd Moeckel, and Prof. Dr. Ajinkya Prabhune, Faculty of SRH University Heidelberg, Germany delivered a lecture on Opportunities in Big data analytics on 2nd Dec 2019. During discussion with students, Prof. Dr. Barbara Spric have explained about their master’s program on Big data analytics, whereas Prof. Dr. Gerd Moeckel have explained about their master’s program in applied computer science. Prof. Dr. Ajinkya Prabhune discussed about their current projects, and requirements of man power in Industry. Total 64 students from the Institute have attended the lecture.Guest lecture on “Higher Education Opportunities in Wayne State University, USA”Ms. Shraddha Singaurey, Recruitment Adviser – India, Office of International Programs , Wayne State University (WSU) had visited our college on 27th Sep 2019 to guide the students about the career opportunities in WSU, USA.During discussion with students, She explained about various scholarships, tuition fees, total living cost, Internship and Job opportunities while pursuing M.S. Total 12 students from different branches attended the programme.Guest lecture on “Higher Education Opportunities in USA”Ms. Aditi Lele, Education USA, USIEF, Mumbai had delivered a lecture on “Higher Education Opportunities in US” on 24th Sep 2019. The topics that were covered during the presentation include the application process, selection of universities, how to construct a good application, and financial aid options. Total 21 students from different branches attended the programme.Guest lecture on “Higher Education Opportunities in RMIT University, Australia” Ms. Prabhali Mazumdar, Country Representative, RMIT, Australia had visited our college on 23rd Feb 2019 to guide the students about the career opportunities in RMIT, Australia.During discussion with students, She explained about various scholarships, tuition fees, total living cost, Internship and Job opportunities while pursuing M.S. Total 11 students from different branches attended the programme.Guest lecture on “Higher Education Opportunities in Wayne State University, US”Ms. Shreya Poddar, Manager, Education Client Engagement and In-Country Admission Coordinator (India) at WSU had visited our college on 15th Feb 2019 to guide the students about the career opportunities in WSU, US. She has delivered the way of writing Statement of purpose (SOP), criteria to get admission and also discussed about total expenses and scholarships at WSU. Total 32 students from different branches attended the programme.Guest lecture on “Higher Education Opportunities in Arizona State University, US” Mr. Deepraj Gahatraj, In-Country Admission Coordinator (India) at ASU had visited our college on 22nd Jan 2019 to guide the students about the career opportunities in ASU, US. Focus was on culture at ASU, Scholarships, Student internships, etc. Total 44 students from different branches attended the programme.Guest lecture on “Preparing Students Equipped with the State of Art Technologies with Appropriate Mix of Fundamentals”.In January 2018, Dr. Kanti Prasad [Professor/Founding Director, Microelectronics/VLSI Technology ,Electrical and Computer Engineering Department from University of Massachusetts Lowell] gave a guest lecture on “Preparing Students Equipped with the State of Art Technologies with Appropriate Mix of Fundamentals”. The main focus of his seminar was to strengthen the Engineering basics of the students i.e. to integrate fundamentals of Physics, Mathematics and Chemistry which must be included compulsorily in all State-of-the-Art courses. Engineering students who are product of such integrated curricula will never become obsolete. Guest lecture on “Preparing Students Equipped with the State of Art Technologies with Appropriate Mix of Fundamentals”. By Dr Kanti Prasad Under guidance cell for higher education (International) various activities are continuously conducted for motivating the students for MS abroad .The key foci of the cell is to provide complete guidance related to higher education in international universities, information related to exams like GRE, TOEFL, IELTS etc, writing SOP’s and LOR, Grade conversion etc depending upon the nature of University .Foreign language training is also imparted to students interested in foreign universities. The following events / activities were organized under this cell. Mr Rahul Batra –Antenna Design Engineer from Hirschman Car Communication, Germany gave a guest lecture on 23/12/2017 about German universities, career and study opportunities and life and culture in Germany.Mr Rahul Batra –Antenna Design Engineer from Hirschman Car Communication, Germany guest lecture for RCOEM students.On 30th January 2018 , Jenny Arkun [Country Manager –International Recruitment ] from University of Adelaide had visited RCOEM campus for “ Guest lecture on Higher Education opportunities in University of Adelaide” and around 35 students participated in the event . The event was organized by Guidance Cell for Higher Education –international under IQAC, RCOEM.Jenny Arkun [Country Manager –International Recruitment ] University of Adelaide addressing RCOEM students.French Delegates from the Consulate were also invited for “Guest lecture on higher education opportunities in France”. Dr. Mrs. Sandrine Maximilien [Attachée for Science and Technology] and Ms Gaelle Lenhardt [Manager Campus France Indore ] from French Embassy briefed the students about – Summer programs, Mobility Exchange, short stay option, Scholarship programs etc . In India there are around 1000 plus French companies [like Renault Kiwi, Minatec, Robot Rosa etc] , scientific and R &D institutes [like Solvay ,Loreal etc] and scholarships [like Eiffel Scholarship and Raman and Charpak Scholarships etc]. They also encouraged the students to take international certification for French language from “Alliances Francaises” which provides French courses, official French exams (recognized by the French Ministry of Education). Campus France is a desk for students who aspire for higher studies in France, cafeteria, translations, tour of the city and any advice related to French speaking countries etc. Even after an hour full of interesting information, RCOEM students were ready for more and came up with lot of queries. The event was organized by Guidance Cell for Higher Education –international under IQAC, RCOEM. Dr. Mrs. Sandrine Maximilien [Attachée for Science and Technology] presents higher education opportunities in France Dr. Mrs. Sandrine Maximilien and Ms Gaelle Lenhardt interact with students.DAAD –Deutscher Akademischer Austauschdienst visits RCOEM :February 28th 2018The Representatives of German Academic Exchange Service (DAAD) – Devi Arand, Honorary Director along with Dhanashree Deodhar, Information and Office Manager had visited the college on 28th February 2018 for a guest Lecture to guide the students about the career, study and research opportunities in Germany. They discussed in brief the education system for Masters in Germany which comprises of technical universities (TU9) and Fach-hochschulen. TU9 universities mainly focus on R&D while Fach-hochschulen are industry-oriented. The public universities mostly waiver the tuition fees while private universities may charge from 500 to 5000 Euros. The students were very interactive and some were also in process of applying to German universities. The session was indeed very informative! The event was organized by Guidance Cell for Higher Education –international under IQAC, RCOEM. Joint International Conferences with Partner UniversitiesInternational Conference “MICON 2016” on “Strategies in the Present Scenario for Managing Growth and Competitiveness” organised by RCOEM in Association with Northumbria University, Newcastle, U.K. in Jan. 2016.International Conference on “Electronic Systems, Signal Processing and Computing Technologies” (ICESC) organized by RCOEM in Association with University of Massachusetts, Lowell, USA and  University of the District of Columbia, Washington, USA, University of Cumbria, U.K., American Society for Engineering  Education (ASEE) with the technical support  of  IEEE in Jan.2014.       Glimpses of International Conference on “Electronic Systems, Signal Processing and Computing Technologies”Short Course at Partner UniversitiesRCOEM students attended a short course on Computer Networking at Northumbria University, Newcastle, U.K. from 20th May to 27th May 2015 conducted by Prof. Mike Fitzgerald. The complete tour was organized and coordinated by Prof. Anish Goel from EC department.RCOEM Students working at Computer Networking Lab at Digital & Computer Science Department at Northumbria University, UK.RCOEM students & Prof. Anish Goel with Prof. Joseph Allen & Prof. Mike Fritzgerald of Northumbria University.RCOEM students at VLSL lab at UMASS LowellRCOEM Students & Prof. Nitin Narkhede with Prof. Kanti Prasad of UMASS Lowell RCOEM students visited UMASS Lowell, USA in June 2012 and undertook training on VLSI by a team of experienced resource persons headed by Prof. Kanti Prasad.  Prof. Nitin Narkhede from EC department RCOEM organized and coordinated the complete tour.Workshops organized in collaboration with Partner Universities1 week Workshop on “Mechatronics” in association with University of the District of Columbia conducted by Dr. Devedas Shetty in Jan.2014.1 week Workshop on “Smart Grid Technologies for community Energy Systems” in association with University of Cumbria, UK conducted by Prof Xiongwei Liu in Jan.2014.1 week Workshop on “Networking Protocols” conducted by Dr. Nirmala Shenoy (Professor in Networking Security and Systems Administration Department and Director – Lab for Wireless Networking and Security, Rochester Institute of Technology, Rochester, USA) at Computer Science Department, RCOEM in Dec 2015.Workshop for Department of Business Management students organized by London School of Training, UK in Jan. 2014.Seminars/Guest Lecture organized in Collaboration with Foreign UniversitiesRCOEM IEEE BRANCH HOLDS GUEST LECTURE RCOEM IEEE students’ Branch in association with IEEE Bombay Section organised a guest lecture of Internationally renowned Dr. Monai Krairiksh from King Mongkut’s Institute of Technology Ladkrabang Bangkok, Thailand. Shri Ramdeobaba College of Engineering and Management as a part of its commitment to provide world class technical education organised Dr. Monai Krairiksh guest lecture on “Remote Sensing of the Physical Qualities of Fruits.”Mrs. Golda Malhotra, Coordinator – India, Sri Lanka and Nepal, Network N+I: Engineering Studies in France interacted with RCOEM students for upcoming applications to Engineering Institutes of Nplusi on 11th Feb. 2016.Prof. Durga Mahdab Misra from NJIT, USA delivered a lecture on “More Moore or More than Moore: CMOS High-k Gate Stacks to Nanotechnology” at RCOEM on 6th Feb. 2016.A lecture on “Microwave Circuit Packaging Fundamentals” by  Dr. Michael Heimlich, Macquarie University, Sydney, Australia was delivered on 21st October 2015,  at  RCOEM. Delegates from Macquarie also discussed about further collaboration with RCOEM.Dr. Nirmala Shenoy, Professor in Networking Security and Systems Administration Department and Director – Lab for Wireless Networking and Security, Rochester Institute of Technology, Rochester NY, USA visited RCOEM to explore the possibility of collaborative research  work on 29th Sept. 2015.
Capability Enhancement (Students)
Capability Enhancement (Students)Effective nurturing, boom and development of the scholars are considered as center values at our institute. This is of prime significance as it helps college students to broaden their character, meet the marketplace desires, and excel within the dynamic global environment.With an enterprise to empower the students to grow to be property to the organizations and make contributions meaningfully to the complete international, college students are supported and facilitated via numerous functionality enhancement and improvement schemes. The capability enhancement and improvement schemes are the stimulating elements in getting the students company-prepared and turn out to be an accountable social citizen.         Prof. Sangita H. Deshmukh : 8275045636email: cap-enhance@rknec.eduCapability enhancement of the students includesGuidance for Competitive Examinations: Competitive exams formulate the basis for various civil services. It is also a necessary foundation to enroll for various higher degree courses in universities situated across the globe. Institute serves the requirements of the students who plan to pursue higher studies or are keen on joining civil services.Soft Skills Development which take care of grooming the students on various components including verbal exchange competencies, presentation talents, crew paintings, networking, time control, motivation, self belief constructing, management capabilities, creative questioning and choice making and so forth.The Student Training Program aims at providing multifaceted skills and leadership qualities to the budding engineers. Thus, helping them in their overall development and securing suitable placement. Institute has initiated this module to develop the right approach, attitude and skills among the students with an intention that they can meet the industry requirements. Students are encouraged to participate in various activities covering group discussion, personal interview, presentations etc. organized at the institute level. 
Higher Education Cell Higher Education Cell - International (UG & PG)
Higher Education Cell – International (UG & PG)         Prof. Sangita H. Deshmukh : 8275045636email: hec@rknec.edu Students of RCOEM are highly ambitious and after graduation many of them apply to foreign universities for Master’s Program. The college has a record breaking list of alumni’s who have pursued higher education from top universities of the world. To support this venture of students, college provides best possible guidance to students aiming for higher education from foreign universities. Students are provided complete counselling including university short-listing, Statement of Purpose preparation, Documents preparations, VISA documentation and VISA interview preparation.Students also apply to partner universities (Universities having MOU with RCOEM) and the cell aims at fetching the best possible option for students in terms of financial aid and admission acceptance. The international collaboration and higher education cell has various objectives that includes arranging students visits/exchange programmes at partner universities, faculty interaction/interchange programmes, organization of joint international conferences, collaborative research work for faculty members and exploring higher education and scholarship options for RCOEM students.Students willing to pursue Higher Studies / Research Internship will register for the same. Aim is to guide, forward Information and resources to students. Also, aims to create a network of students applying for the same universities.

 MEMORANDUM OF UNDERSTANDING The Institute has signed MoU with Public, Private & Government Organisations with focus on Consultancy, Projects, Industry Visit, Faculty Training, Co Teaching etc.List of MoU with Industry See hereList of MoU with Industry Association See hereList of MoU with Government Organisation See hereList of MoU with University/Educational Institute See here
RCOEM III Brochure
RCOEM III Brochure The Institute is looking for opportunities to collaborate with Industries in various domains. For the ease of identifying opportunities, the Institute has come up with Consultancy Brochure mentioning the Strengths of various departments. Industry experts are requested to go through the Brochure & connect with respective Departments.RCOEM III Brochure   Click Here
Consultancy
ConsultancyThe Institute is actively involved not only with local Industry but with Industries having national presence. Consultancy Projects are undertaken with a combination of Faculty & Students of College.MAJOR CONSULTANCY PROJECTS UNDERTAKEN BY FACULTY:Technical Enhancement of the Moodle LMS SoftwareSetting up the III Conclaves
III ConclavesThe Institute encourages dialogue between Industry & Institution. Number of of initiatives are undertaken by various Department for engaging the Industry experts.Few of the Programmes organised are:“33rd Chapter Convention on Quality Concepts 2022” Jointly Organized by QCFI Nagpur Chapter & RCOEM.   See Here“32nd Digital Chapter Convention on Quality Concepts 2021” Jointly Organized by QCFI Nagpur Chapter & RCOEM.   See Here“31st Digital Chapter Convention on Quality Concepts 2020” Jointly Organized by QCFI Nagpur Chapter & RCOEM.  See Here“30th Chapter Convention on Quality Concepts 2019” Jointly Organized by QCFI Nagpur Chapter & RCOEM.  See HereHR Shapers Conclave- Program organised by Department of Computer Applications   See HereSamvaad- Annual program by Department of Management Technology  See HereEmpower – Annual program by Department of Electrical Engineering  See HerePragati 2017- Project Reforms & Analysis Group for Adapting Technology in Industry  See HereIndustry-Academia Meet Jointly organised by Directorate of Technical Education, Maharashtra State & RCOEM  See Here

Industry Internship program attended by Faculty
Institute has a policy to send Faculty members for Internship in the Industry. This helps in updating the skill sets of Faculty that will help in delivering the Course content effectively to the students.Three Faculty members from Department of Mechanical Engineering attended Five Days FDP on NVH at La Fondation Dassault Systems, Pune- Maharashtra.One Faculty member from Department of Mechanical Engineering has completed 15 days Training of Trainers in 3DPAM at NIELIT Calicut.One Faculty member from Department of Physics was sent for Two Days at Kwality Photonics, Hyderabad.Two Faculty members from Department of Electronics Engineering were sent for Two Days at Archerchem Callibrations Laboratory, Mumbai – Maharashtra.Two Faculty members from Department of Electronics Engineering were sent for One Day at South Eastern Coalfields Limited (SECL), Bilaspur – Chattisgarh.Two Faculty members from Department of Management Technology were sent for One Month Internship at Future Supply Chain & Spacewood Office Solutions.Two Faculty Member from Electronics Engineering were sent to attend Interactive Seminar organised by MIA in association with GIZ- MSME.

Corporate Social Responsibility


Home 






















 SOCIAL ACTIVITYShri Ramdeobaba College of Engineering and Management is not only known for its high academic standards but it is committed to ameliorating the standards of the society as a whole. In an attempt to outreach to the society various departments of the college organise social, cultural and spiritual activities. Students are motivated to contribute to various social causes. College realises that community service is one of the essential element of true education. 











 















Mega Blood Donation Camp at RCOEMShri Ramdeobaba College of Engineering and Management, organised Mega Blood Donation Camp today in the College premises. The college organises blood donation camp annually as part of its Institutional social responsibility. The camp was organised in association with Dr. Hedgewar Blood Bank with contribution from College Management, students of all the Departments of Engineering, Management, MCA and NSS Volunteers. The Blood Donation Camp witnessed a count of 360 donors with a registration of 500 people which included students, teaching and non-teaching staff with active participation of people of Nagpur. The event ended up with words of appreciation and encouragement by His Excellency Shri Banwarilalji Purohit, Honourable Governor of Tamil Nadu.The event was also graced by Shri Shyamsundar Rathi, Shri Govindlalji Agrawal, Shri Rajendra Purohit, Shri Ashokkumar Pacheriwala, Adv. Pradip Agrawal and Principal RCOEM, Dr. Rajesh Pande. 











  











 











The event was organised from 9 am to 4 pm in the Ramdeobaba college premises under the teacher guidance- Prof. Vishal Mehta, Prof. Ashlesh Jaiswal, Dr. Amit Anurag, Prof. Ashish Urade, Prof Swati Moghe, Prof. Saket Kanetkar and students-Yash Singhania, Shrutika Patel, Sanjeet Muley, Ayush Singh, Tejas Nakhate, Ashwin Deshmukh, Tanuj Tiwari, Engineering, Management department and NSS 











 



























JASHN 2017Department of Management Technology (DMT), Shri Ramdeobaba College of Engineering and Management, Nagpur organized Jashn 2017 – Let’s Live it Together in the college campus recently. This event was for the specially-abled children and children from orphanages. 185 children participated in the drawing and dance competitions conducted. Read More 











 











ECO FRIENDLY GANESH IDOL OF RCOEM WINS FIRST PRIZEPrioritizing protection of environment as a key concern, the College on the occasion of Ganesh Chaturthi this year, has made an attempt to install Ganapati idol made from potash alum, also known as fitkari, which is commonly used in Indian households to clean water and make it potable.After its immersion this idol will clean the water body and the colour used in it won’t pollute the environment unlike other harmful colours. The Environment friendly nature of this idol which does not have any adverse impact on environment has garnered appreciation and attention nationwide. As a result, many well-known media houses like NDTV and Zee News did a special coverage to highlight this different attempt which has set a bench mark for CLEAN & GREEN Nagpur. Read More 











 



























Ramkatha and Hanuman katha discourse by Vijay Kaushalji Maharaj at RCOEM:-In order to promote and spread spiritual values, RCOEM invited reverend Shri Vijay Kushalji Maharaj of Vrindavan to deliver spiritual discourse on Ram Katha . All the stakeholders of the college wholeheartedly participated in the spiritual event. The discourses which lasted from 11th January to 18th January 2016 drew more than 10,000 devotees from Nagpur and adjacent areas. Entire campus was sanctified by holy presence of Maharaji, his enchanting discourses in the presence of 1000’s of devotees. 











 



















Youth Week :-Youth Week was celebrated from 12th to 16th January 2015 to mark the birth anniversary of Swami Vivekananda. Awareness was created among the students by talks and by displaying posters to draw their attention towards the ill-effects of smoking, drugs, etc…..Students were motivated to channelize their time and energy in creative task drawing inspiration from Swami Vivekananda. More than 200 students were a part of this event.Wall magazine Inauguration:-Teacher’s day was celebrated by inaugurating the wall Magazine in the department of Electronics Engineering at Shri Ramdeobaba College of Engineering and Management. Mr Tejas Moonje Assistant Commissioner of Police (Intelligence Service) inaugurated the Magazine. Dr. (Mrs.) A.A. Khurshid Head of the Department, faculty members and students were prominently present on the occasion .The wall magazines comprise of technical, art and literary sections.GRAFFITI wall design:-Fantastic Art Work Concept has been initialized in year 2014-2015 called as GRAFFITI WALL. This concept is being brought up for several Social causes in collaboration with a Social Organization Aagaz. The Graffiti wall was design by students of Electronics Engineering near Electronics building and near RCOEM playground Management of RCOEM, Principal Dr. R.S.Pande, HOD Dr. (Mrs) A.A. Khurshid and faculty members congratulated Electrolitz –students Society for this noble gesture.Stationary donation on teacher’s day:-SEVA DISHA a Social responsibility cell of Electrolitz- Students’ Society of Electronics Engineering department donated school stationary and sporting equipments to platform school students on 5th Sept 2014. A Platform Gyan Mandir is the residential school run by Vishwa Hindu Jankalyan Parishad in association with Nagpur Municipal Corporation & Nagpur Railway Police at Bajeriya , near Santra Market Railway Gate. Electrolitz society in charges Prof. B.M Hardas, Prof. Gouri Morankar and Society President Pratik Jhawar and his team distributed material to students. Management of RCOEM, Principal Dr. R.S.Pande, HOD, Dr.(Mrs)A.A.Khurshid and Faculty members congratulated Electrolitz-Students’ Society for this noble gesture. 











 



























Clothes donation to Nepal Earthquake Victims:-SEVA DISHA a social responsibility cell of Electrolitz- Student’s Society of Electronics Engineering department donated clothes and other material to Devi Ahilya Mandir Samrak Samiti for the support of people in Nepal following the devastating earthquake. The clothes were sent to Nepal via workers of Rashtra Sewika Samiti and Sewa Bharati.Annakoot:-Every year in the month of Kartik Annakoot is observed by in RCOEM campus. The pooja starts in the gracious presence of Chairman Shri Banwarilal Purohit and other management members. The Principal, HODs, Faculty, and students actively participate in this religious festival. As a social commitment, free meals are served over 10,000 devotees on this occasion. Prayers are offered for the wellbeing of all seeking the blessings of Shri Ramdeobaba.Mission Education Program:-In its endeavour to teach students moral values and their responsibilities towards society, Department of Information Technology along with the NSS unit of the college joined hands with the “Mission Education” program of Manav Utthan Sewa Samiti, Nagpur.Manav Utthan Sewa Samiti (M.U.S.S.) is an all-India registered voluntary social welfare and charitable organization. Under this program, two stationary donation boxes were installed at the college premises on 18th April 2016 to collect stationary material from the students and staff. This material will be distributed to the under privileged school going kids in and around Nagpur. One of the boxes has been installed at IT Department and the other at G-Block of the college. The first collection of stationary material from the two boxes was handed over to the volunteers of the samiti on 30th May 2016. The samiti has given a certificate to the college appreciating the lead taken by them in promoting the Mission Education Program. 











 



















Good Governance Day:-Good Governance Day on 25th December, the birth date of former Prime Minister Shri Atal Bihari Bajpai, Shri Ramdeobaba College of Engineering and Management organized an inter-branch elocution Competition on “Technology and Innovation to promote Good Governance” on 24th December 2014. More than 20 students from different branches discussed the current and future role of technology and innovation in good governance in India. The competition was organized under agies of Readers’ Reverie, a Readers’ club hosted by Department of Humanities of RCOEM.Shri Govindlalji Agrawal, General Secretary of RCOEM congratulated the students for logically expressing their views on the topic of Good Governance. Dr. Rajesh Pande, the Principal of the college expressed satisfaction that awareness about Good Governance among students will pave the path for the development of the nation and the society. Dr. V.H. Asudani, Head, Department of Humanities, in his introductory remarks emphasized the importance of such competitions which not only promote communication skills among students but also orient them in important skills such as Good Governance. The winners were given cash prizes of Rs.15000/-, Rs.10000/- and Rs.5000/- respectively.Constitution Day:-Constitution Day was observed by Department of Humanities in collaboration with SRC of college on 26th November 2015. Students collectively read out the preamble of the constitution. On this occasion Principal, Dr. R.S.Pande , Dean SRC Prof. Sangeet Deshmukh, HOD Humanities Dr.V.H.Asudani and HOD Physical Education Dr.S.Dogra were prominently present.Constitution Week :-As a part of celebration of 125th Birth year of Dr.B.R.Ambedkar Readers’Riverie Literary Club of the college organised week long activities to create awareness about the significant work done by Dr. B.R Ambedkar as the architect of Indian Constitution. The various activities which were organised included Hindi Elocution, English Elocution , Quiz, Youth Parliament etc……..More than 100 students participated in these activities, which concluded on 14th January 2016.Helping the Blind :-Department of Humanities realises the social responsibility towards differently able students. The small projects and models which are prepared by the students of RCOEM are donated to the blind school with the objective that the blind students will learn many things by exploring these models. Dr.V.H.Asudani who has overcome his visually impairment by achieving extra ordinary achievement orients the blind students free of charge to help them to face competitive examinations.JASHN, a step towards inclusive society :-Realising its social commitment, RCOEM continually makes efforts to include even the marginalised sections of society in the ongoing process of social development. Department of management Technology, for last 2 years, organises the annual event JASHN to provide platform to differently able and orphan children to showcase their talent and be the part of main stream of society. This program was organised in the month of February 2016 for this year – Let’s Live it Together in the College campus . Jashn celebrated the joy of giving and receiving. For it is in giving, that we receive The children were taught crafts like bamboo work, decorative paper bags, quilling items, greeting cards, etc. The products made as a result of the workshops were displayed through stalls and each of these items sold like hot cakes. Drawing competition in the morning and a Cultural Program in the evening was organized, where there were 150 participating children. The Drawing Competition had three age groups of – 5-10, 11-14, 15 – 18 and three prizes in each. The Cultural Program, which included a dance competition wherein there were 9 competing teams along with 2 special performances by Matru Seva Sangh and Shradhanand Peth Anathalay. Bharat Muk Badhir bagged the first prize whereas the spirited young boys of Yuvajyothi placed second. The children were from 10 institutes/orphanages namely, Matru Seva Sangh, Shri Kisan Muk Badhir, Shaskiye Mulanche Balgruh, Shradhanand Peth Anathalaya, Sarojini Chari Memorial, Jeevan Ashray Aashram, Bharat Muk Badhir Vidyalaya, Yuvajyothi, Prayas and Roshan Bal Sadan. The organizing team even initiated a successful raddi (scrap) campaign, collecting approximately 5000 kgs of scrap to raise funds for the event. 























  






Practical Exposure
RCOEM’s industry collaboration ensure practical exposure for students. 


  






Culture of Continuous Learning
We focus on research and innovation to create a culture of consistent learning. 


  






Experienced Faculty
Our experienced faculties provide personalized attention to students.  


  






All-round development
Our emphasis on co-curricular activities nurtures all-round development of students.

Awards Gallery
Faculty AwardsARCEON’21 bagged second prize in the annual Magazine competition organized by Shri Rashtrasant Tukadoji Maharaj Nagpur University  Dr. Sunita Dhote, Professor in Shri Ramdeobaba College of Engineering and Management won Women Bhaskar Award 2019 under Adventure Category on 8th May,2019Dr Rajeshree Raut, Professor and Head of the Department, Electronics Design Technology, RCOEM was awarded the Prestigious National Award for Outstanding Research work in EngineeringDr. Gayathri Band, Assistant Professor, Department of Management Technology has been conferred with “Young Researcher” Award in the individual category RTMNU has awarded Dr Rajesh Pande, Principal of RCOEM as the Best Principal.Best Teacher (Social Worker) award conferred upon Prof B M Hardas, Assistant Professor in Electronics engineering, RCOEM.Padma Shree and Rajya Sabha MP Dr Vikas Mahatme was the chief guest while Vice-Chancellor of RTMNU Dr S P Kane presided over. Dr Pramod Yeole, Pro-Vice Chancellor, RTMNU, grace the event.Padma Shree and Rajya Sabha MP Dr Vikas Mahatme was the chief guest while Vice-Chancellor of RTMNU Dr S P Kane presided over. Dr Pramod Yeole, Pro-Vice Chancellor, RTMNU, grace the event. Rashtrasant Tukadoji Maharaj Nagpur University (RTMNU) has adjudged Dr Rajesh Pande, Principal of Shri Ramdeobaba College of Engineering and Management (RCOEM) as the Best Principal. Dr Pande was honoured during a programme organized to mark the Teacher’s Day on September 5, at Guru Nanak Bhavan, RTMNU campus.RCOEM received not one but two honours — Best Principal Award and Best Teacher (Social Worker) award conferred upon Prof B M Hardas, Assistant Professor in Electronics engineering, RCOEM. Padma Shree and Rajya Sabha MP Dr Vikas Mahatme was the chief guest while Vice-Chancellor of RTMNU Dr S P Kane presided over. Dr Pramod Yeole, Pro-Vice Chancellor, RTMNU, grace the event. Management, faculty and staff members of RCOEM congratulated Dr. R.S.Pande and Prof. B.M.Hardas for this achievementAward of Best MagazineBest-Magazine-Award 2019Best-Magazine-Award 2016Best-Magazine-Award 2015Best-Magazine-Award 2014RCOEM won KC Bajaj Trophy by the hands of P. Gopichand(International Badminton Player/ Coach) for Best College in Sports Promotion from Sports Journalist Association Of Nagpur & Raisoni Achievers in Annual Award 2016 on 23rd Oct 2016 Rashtrasant Tukadoji Maharaj Nagpur University (RTMNU) has adjudged Dr. V.S.Deshpande, Principal of Shri Rameobaba College of Engineering and Management (SRCOEM) as Best Principal.Dr. J.M. MAHAJAN AWARD – 2013–Dr. J.M. Mahajan Award to Dr. V.S. DeshpandeShayesta Akhtar Memorial National Award for Best Engineering College Teacher for the year 2013” to Dr. Rajeshree Raut.Best Teacher AwardEducational Excellence AwardAward was presented on September 9, 2012 at 4.00 pm in Taj Krishna, Hyderabad.DR. S. R. GOLLAPUDI AWARD FOR DR. RUPESH S. PAISGOLD MEDALS FOR DR. SUNITA DHOTEHonourable Sushil Kumar Shende, then Home Minister of India felicitating Dr. Asudani Grand-daughter of Mahatma Gandhi Mrs. Tara Bhattacharya and others look onRashtrasant Tukadoji Maharaj Nagpur University (RTMNU) has adjudged Dr. V.S.Deshpande, Principal of Shri Rameobaba College of Engineering and Management (SRCOEM) as Best Principal. He was conferred upon the award on August 4 at 11 am during university foundation programme.Dr. Deshpande is a Mechanical Engineer with long-standing experience in research and development. He has published 40 research papers in national and international journals and has presented more than 80 research papers in national and international conferences and seminars. Dr. Deshpande has successfully completed six consultancy projects.Best Principal Award Award by RTM Nagpur University.Dr. V.S.Deshpande, Principal of RCOEM has been conferred with Best Principal 2012

Academic Council


Home 






















 Academic CouncilTerm.- The term of the nominated members shall be three years ;Meetings.- Academic Council shall meet at least twice a year.Powers and Functions of the Academic Council.—–The Academic Council shall have the following powers and functions:a) To scrutinize and approve the proposals with or without modifications of the Board of Studies with regard to course of study, academic regulations, curricula, syllabi and modifications. Thereof, instructional and evaluation arrangements, methods, procedures relevant thereto etc. Provided that where the Academic Council differs on any proposal, it will have to return the right to any matter for reconsideration to the Board of Studies concerned or reject it, after giving reasons to do so.To make regulations regarding the admission of students to different programmes of study in the college keeping in view the policy of the Government.To make regulations for sports, extra-curricular activities, and proper maintenance and functioning of the playgrounds and hostels.To recommend to the Board of Management proposals for institution of new programmes of study.To recommend to the Board of Management, scholarships, studentship, fellowships, prizes and medals, and to frame regulations for the award of the same.To advise to the Board of Management on suggestion(s) pertaining to academic affairs made by it.Perform such other functions as may be assigned by the Board of Management.ACADEMIC COUNCIL (2022-23)Sr.NoCategoryNameDesignation1PrincipalDr. R. College Grievance Redressal Cell


Home 






















 College Grievance Redressal Cell (CGRC)(As per Para 5(3) of Uniform Statute 5 of 2019 of University)College Grievance Redressal Cell (CGRC)” means a Cell constituted under this Statute, at the level of a college or recognized institution, Functional mechanism of working of the Students’ Grievance Redressal Cell In this statute unless the context otherwise requires,—) “aggrieved student” means a student who has any complaint in the matter concerned with the grievances defined under this statute and includes a person seeking admission to a university or college or recognized institution of higher education ;) “declared admission policy” means such policy for admission to a course or program of study as may be offered by the university or college or recognized institution and published in the prospectus ;) “grievances” include the following complaints of the aggrieved students, namely :—making admission contrary to merit determined in accordance with the declared admission policy of the State and university ;irregularity in the admission process by the university or college or recognized institution;refusing admission in accordance with the declared admission policy as published in prospectus ;non-publication of prospectus either hard copy or online, as specified in para 3 of this Statute ;publishing any information in the prospectus, which is false or misleading, and not based on facts ;withhold or refuse to return any document in the form of certificates of degree, diploma or any other award or other document deposited with the university or college or recognized institution by a person while seeking admission in such university or college or recognized institution, with a view to induce or compel such person to pay any fee or fees in respect of any course or program of study which such person does not intend to pursue ;demand of money in excess of that specified in the declared admission policy or approved by the competent authority to be charged by such university or college or recognized institution ;breach of the policy for reservations in admission as may be applicable ;insisting upon students to submit the original academic and personal certificates and testimonials like mark sheets, school leaving certificate and other such documents at the time of admission, wherever such original documents are not compulsorily required ;complaints of alleged discrimination of students on the grounds of gender, race, caste, class, creed, place of birth, religion and disability;non-payment or delay in payment of scholarships to any student by the university or college or recognized institution after receiving the same from concerned authority;non-adherence of rules of refund of fees in case of cancellation of admission;undue delay in conduct of examinations or declaration of results beyond that specified in the academic calendar ;failure to provide student amenities as may have been promisedor required to be provided by the university or college or recognized institution ;non-transparent or unfair evaluation practices ;Sr.No.NameDesignationAddress01Dr. R. S. Pande, PrincipalChairpersonShri Ramdeobaba College of Engineering and Management, Gittikhadan, Katol Road, Nagpur – 4400 01302Prof.(Mrs.)Poorvi K. Joshi,Deptt. of Electronics Engg.MemberShri Ramdeobaba College of Engineering and Management, Gittikhadan, Katol Road, Nagpur – 4400 01303Dr. Rashmi Shahu, Deptt. of Industrial Engg., Dean SRCMemberShri Ramdeobaba College of Engineering and Management, Gittikhadan, Katol Road, Nagpur – 4400 013

Students’ Welfare and Counseling Cell


Home 






















 Students’ Welfare and Counseling Cell (Constituted in accordance with Uniform Statute No. 3 of 2019 Section-12 issued by Higher and Technical Education, GoM)Sr.NoNameDepartment1Dr. Rashmi Sahu   (Coordinator) Dean SRCIndustrial Engineering2Mrs. Sonal TripathiHumanities3Dr.Gaurav GoyalElectrical Engineering4Dr. (Mrs.) Monika SethHumanities5Mrs. Akanksha DeshpandeHumanitiesOBJECTIVE:Students nowadays are faced with a number of issues related to academics and otherwise during their student life. They are in need of an outlet to express their emotions. This is where a student Counseling Cell comes into picture. The most common issues faced by students are related to time management, stress management, peer pressure, procrastination, body language, communication skills etc. One-to-one counseling sessions with the student counselor helps our students to sort out these issues and unburden themselves of their problems. Also Counseling helps to monitor and meet the academic and welfare activities of students.ASSOCIATED ACTIVITIES:By making the sessions light and interactive, the student counselor creates a conducive environment for the students to facilitate effective communication. Counseling helps the students concentrate better on their studies without getting emotionally drained by other issues. The academic and welfare activities of students belonging to physically challenged, women and other weaker sections are properly looked into by this cell.Services offered:Need based CounselingAcademic CounselingWelfare ServicesGrievance Redressa;Any other matter related to students welfare.

Health and Safety Committee


Home 






















 Health and Safety CommitteeA committee is constituted to ensure the Health and Safety of all the concerned during their presence on campus. The committee will be called as HEALTH AND SAFETY COMMITTEE. It shall have the following objectives;To Proactively ensure prevention of hazards of any nature in the institute and its facilities.To ensure planning and compliance of all aspects of health and safety.Ensure compliance in operating to the highest possible standards of safety and health.Members Of the CommitteeSno.NameDesignation1One senior Professor, ChairmanDr. M.B. Chandak, Professor Computer Science & Engg.2Management RepresentativeShri Dinesh Agrawal3Two Senior Faculty (one each from Electrical & Civil Engg. Disciplines)Dr. U.B. About NPTEL


Home 






















  The National Programme on Technology Enhanced Learning (NPTEL) was initiated by seven Indian Institutes of Technology (Bombay, Delhi, Kanpur, Kharagpur, Madras, Guwahati and Roorkee) along with the Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore in 2003. NPTEL started offering certification on courses offered in the open online mode, based on the MOOCs model.Largest online repository in the world of courses in Engineering, Basic Sciences and selected Humanities and Social Sciences subjects.NPTEL helps disseminate online teaching/learning content of high quality and uses Information Technology for dissemination.All those who are gainfully employed in industries and all other walks of life and require continuous training and updating their knowledge can also benefit from well-developed and peer-reviewed course contents by the IITs, IISc and other partner institutions in NPTEL.NPTEL conducts Online in-person, proctored certification examination twice a year. The objective of this examination is to enable students to obtain certificates for NPTEL courses and make them employable in the industry or pursue a suitable higher education programme. The advanced NPTEL courses are also being recognized by AICTE as Faculty development programs (FDP).NPTEL courses are open for anyone to access – at no cost. So anyone who is interested in learning gets access to quality content, which also includes discussion with the content creator and access to assignments for self testing.To know more visit :https://nptel.ac.in
